Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 02:37PM SuebeeBC wrote: Melanie - if youre interested in biking, try to find someone who already does or look into a local bike group.  Around here they even have womens only ones.  I know without someone stronger than me to bike with, I would never get motivated.  Now that DH and I invested so much in the new bikes and the bike paths are awesome here, we have lots of incentive to get out.  But i am SO weak!!!  I dont want to ride with my BFF again until I am a lot less embarrasing! Maria - snacking...whoa.  Well, before my diagnosis in November, and before I decided to get into shape in June, I was a horrible snacker!!  I lost 10 of the inital pounds by adding a 30 minute walk to my day and following Dr Oz's YOU on a Diet.  I didnt use the recipes, but I did use the philosphy and did a lot of what he suggested for snacking.  My snacks are primarily fruit, nuts or whole grain english muffins, breads, etc with peanut butter or an egg, yogurts with berries.  His book has ideas for nighttime snacks....usually if I am dying at night, I make my black bean and corn salsa and have it alone, on spinach or with whole grain, natural chips.  I also like cheese and would have 1-2 oz with some grapes of Gouda or Edam http://healthybodydaily.com/dr-oz-cancer/dr-oz-gouda-cheese-can-reduce-cancer-risk-three-secret-weapons-to-prevent-cancer But to be honest, once I got through the inital 6 weeks, I was basically eating a yogurt with blueberries for morning snack, and an apple with a handful of almonds (with the skins) for afternoon snack and foregoing the evening snack altogether.  I have since been really turned off to sweets...I dont eat cookies, cakes and the like - but I do like dark chocolate and indulge in ice cream from our local dairry farm (but rarely).  I had to change how I looked at foods...its funny how some really turn me off now. Hey I found an all natural iced green tea with mango...and of course now I see someone threw away the can - but its made with green tea, mango juice, cane sugar, and ginsing I think.  3 servings in one can.  The can was tall and black and the tea was super yummy and 60 calories a serving.  I can do that! And today I braved the saturday zumba class!  I LOVED IT!  It was all abs today and it felt great.  I did finally tell my instructors wife (kind of co-instructor) about my surgery and she was great about it.  Just how I like it - "well, it stinks but its done and you can start healing and moving forward now"...yes I can!  Party tonight at my house - DH invited friends over and he never does that so I am putting on a happy face!  The house is CLEAN and looks great!  I hope I can make it past my usual 10pm bedtime however!!!  LOL

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2011 11:46AM SuebeeBC wrote: WOW its been 26 hours...hope everyone is OK!!! No exercise for me today - I got my second fill. Im at 255 now!!!  I was expecting a 50cc fill but when I told him the 75cc's last time didnt bother me at all, we pushed to 80ccs today!!! I am really happy for that extra 30 because it bring me closer and closer.  I am expecting a 350 implant so in less than a month I should have an idea of what I will look like!  Of course then he will overfill.  I tried to get him to explain the nipple procedure but we got off topic and never heard how he does it.  Ill have to ask again as it gets closer. I hope to get to Zumba tomorrow but I need to work out how to start cammoflaguing the old girl now.  There is a dramatic difference between the two.  I think Im the only one around here not pushing for spring....then I really have to cammo myself!!! LOL!! Hope you all had a great day.  Tonights dinner is lasagne...not so healthful....except for the spinach inside and no meat.  Baby steps!!

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 12:13PM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Afternoon!!! Its FRIDAY!!! Today is exercise day off for me except for dog walking.  Ive been doing 100 little projects all day long which is a great relief.  Part spring cleaning, part pre-planning, part catch up, part organizing. Maria - I totally hear you on the olives.  It really took me sitting in Naples for me to put a darn green olive in my mouth!!!  I was so surprised what FRESH ones taste like!!!  Mmmmmm.  I figured you knew about the chicken too...its amazing whats on packages!  I still make my chili with beer....the alcohol cooks off, right?  :) Redsky - good to take it easy.  I was soooo fatigued for about 8 weeks and even after that I didnt have endurance at all.  Now that I have been back to Zumba I can FEEL myself getting stronger.  It just takes time. Melanie - thanks for the recipe.  I have been cooking a lot with Black Beans since last summer so this is another one to try for sure!  Im sorry about your arm...what is Axillary Web Syndrome?  I havent heard of that.  I have 'nerve damage' so Im told as my under arm and radiating down I have this dull ache (sometimes not so dull)  when I sit still. It used to be so bad I would have to leave the room for a different chair and put my arm over my head for an hour since pain meds did nothing.  But now I can tell its definitely improving....its been a week since Ive had to massage it but even right now I can feel the dull sensation....it just isnt flaring as much. I mentioned dinner is the mexican lasagne....and thanks to me bringing it up, we are having Toasties tomorrow night with soup.  Im contemplating trying a curried butternut squash soup for the first time.  I think chili might be too heavy.  Ive been over-doing it on my tortilla soup lately too.  Hmmmm.....maybe a cream of broccoli?  I know everyone will end up wanting cambells tomato...LOL!!!  Kids! Enjoy your night!!! Its movie night here and we are introducing the kids to the Back to the Future Trilogy....just part one tonight to see if they like it.  I also picked up Mrs Doubtfire because the scene where her boobs are on fire and she put them out with pot lids reminds me that I will not have feeling in my 'projections' and always joke "if they were on fire, I wouldnt know it".  LOL

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2011 06:37AM SuebeeBC wrote: Mornin' Just in from a fill....he put in another 80 today!!!  I was shocked!!!  I could feel the expansion this time as he was doing it.  The last two he stopped because he felt I was done...This time he said "that's 80!" and I said it was probably a good place to stop then.  I knew I would feel it later this time.  But now Im at 335.  350 was the inital goal for an implant.  I think I am experiencing boob greed now because I dont want to stop at 350!!!!  We talked about size again and this time instead of saying "Full B" I said "C".  Hey look, if Im doing this well with expansions, why not go for the initial goal (pre-cancer)??  But this is all a topic for another forum! Barbara - I am SOOO glad the chicken worked out for you!!  Its so easy and cost effective to roast your own.  And it really isnt much effort once you know how.  I try to do some kind of roast every Sunday from Fall to Spring.  It doesnt take much leftover meat to make a southwestern soup or chowder either. Just a thought. Melanie - SO sorry about your arm but I am really glad they caught it early enough that it may work out.  Ill be thinking of you.  And I LOVE Chick-Fila!!!  When I went on my initial diet, the Doctor Oz diet, the grilled chick-fila sandwich was the only 'fast food' item that wasnt totally poo-poo'ed.  And at a whopping 30 grams of protein, I was eating at least one or two a week while trying to heal my incision because I was trying to get to 100g a day.  Anniemom - so your PS doesnt overfill?  Sounds like he is going with a larger implant that what youre filled at currently.  Glad your fills are done!!!  Thats awesome.  We talked about the exchange a little today - he said my TE looks great and I probably wont need much pocket work at ALL during the exchange.  And he plans to do a Star Flap for the nipple which was a new one on me...I thought he would do a skate. Rennsus - DARN that incision, girl!!!!  I know it stinks to sit still....BELIEVE me I know!!!  But we have to get that healed!!!  Ill thinking of you. Maria - Yes, you are a cute thing...I popped over to take a peek at your pic....messy hair and all. We do BFD (breakfast for dinner) a lot around here.  The British like baked beans with their breakfast (in the tomato based sauce - not the Boston molassas style) so we adopted that.    I usually do a lightly sauteed tomato and mushrooms with ours.....Im so Irish.  Im not a big sausage and bacon fan but the kids still are. Im off to Zumba Toning.  I changed my fill times so I can make Tuesday Zumba again.  I was missing it every other week.  I just have to figure out what to do with my boob...and foob.  Im so lopsided now.  Tonight Im hosting book club so Ill be spending the rest of the afternoon cleaning and setting up for that!!  Have a great day!

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 04:25AM - edited Apr 21, 2011 09:13AM by SuebeeBC Goood Morning.  How is everyone today?  Its the last school day before a 4 day weekend here so Ill be running around today for sure!  The weather is supposed to be cooler than expected (55 by days end) so I may have to bag the bikeride.  If I start after noon, I wont get to my son's choir practice at 2 which I help out at.  My rides usually start around 9:30.   It might be only in the 40's still at that point. Barbara - enjoy your weekend!  I would LOVE to be going out of town!!! Renna - SO great to see your picture finally!!!  Ill get you that recipe later on.  Its a little project to make but once you know a couple of tricks, its easy.  Your beauty day sounds FANTASTIC!!  Im a little jealous!  My BFF wants to do a spa day soon but with us not working, Im a little afraid of spending any money....and she likes to go to a pricey place! Maria - good luck at the water park!!! I can totally understand what youre saying!  We bought amusement park passes for the summer and they have a waterpark section.  I SO want the exchange to be done so I can go swimming!!! As for the bras, a lot of women on another thread love the Danskin sport bras...they have a zip front one too.  I got one yesterday because my other ones (also danskin) were rubbing on my TE (the underwire).  Remember I HAVE to wear a bra because I need to now 'fluff' my natural girl to match.  I only wear one when my clothing would make my MX obvious - like Zumba or a very warm day.  The good news is that my TEs arent totally in a weird shape - or in my arm pit yet.  Because they are flat on top, I dont fully fill the front of a cup but the Danskin ones have a thin foam to keep shape and hide nipple projection (if ya got em) so those bras look great on. Anniemom - yeah that last chemo is coming.  I think you have the right idea to lay low.  I imagine it will be a poignant moment for you and I know I dont know how I would feel about closing that chapter.  I am trying to plan a girls weekend with BFF for after exchange...and another weekend with DH (We've never been away alone since our honeymoon).  I cant wait to start moving on!  The hospital isnt all men....just military.  The Surgery Clinic really is all airmen (men and women) who just get my vitals and stick me in the room.  There is ONE tech who knows how to set up the fills for the doc but no one is in the room when PS does fills.  One nurse from Colonoscopy came by one day to observe but probably because its facinating....I havent seen her since.   As for Bras - see what I wrote to Maria, but go on Walmart.com and look at the Danskins. Very comfortable (except the underwire ones)...and give the TEs a much better shape.  Ive also heard good things about coobie bras.  You can google them. Oh and Anniemom - I forgot to mention that I did the Dr Oz YOU on a Diet program....I picked it up at the library.  I didnt use the recipes, but followed breakfast/lunch and snack plans and the exercise program  I found that the 'when' was as important as the 'what' you ate....and why certain foods reduced belly fat or make the weight come off...it was interesting stuff.  I lost 9 pounds really quickly....paused a but, and dropped another 6...but that second drop was all exercise and fat to muscle as I wasnt watching my food anymore....I went size 8 to 4 and havent gained any back.

Posts.Content: May 3, 2011 10:10AM SuebeeBC wrote: Melanie - I have a Trek Lexa SL.  All of the Womens Specific Design bikes by Trek in Aluminum frame are Lexa....but the components make the bikes range from 1300 dollars down to 700 dollars.  My bike is one step down from the top because I couldnt justify the small difference in the shifters from the Shimano Tiagaras and the Shimano 105's.  The salesperson even said as a beginner, I wouldnt notice a difference.  I test rode a Cannondale and Giant as well - all excellent bikes really...so my suggestion is to go to three shops (they never carry all types) and test ride them out and ask the same questions at each place.  You'll know when you find the one that fits like a glove.  I spent 2.5 hours between the 600 dollar cannondale and 800 giant....and then we went to another shop and by the time I went around the parking lot, the Trek was mine.  I adore it.  But also budget another 2-300 for shoes, pedals, shorts etc..  Its OK to get a 7-800 dollar bike as a beginner and one shop actually recommended it (it was a Fuji - also well recommended as a beginnner bike)...but please, please get it custom FIT!!!  It makes all of the difference!  If you need more info than that, feel free to PM me!!! Well, no Zumba for me today  I had discomfort last night that turned into a UTI at 5am - owie!  So I spent 4 hours at the ER this morning (my clinic had no appointments today).  I will let this get a little better before I zumba or bike again....I am hoping to get a ride in on Thursday!!  Funny coincidence....my BFF's son has a bad rash up his leg and came into the ER about an hour after me.  I said "jeesh if you wanted to spend time with me, there are better ways than following me to the ER!!!)  At least we got some time to chat!!! Dinner is plain and easy - grilled chicken breast over salad....with zucchini. Annie and Melanie - hope you feel charged up soon!  But for now, Im going to catch up on MY shows and be a slug this afternoon!

Redsky - No, I think I was fine when I first started riding again.  It was about 8 or 9 weekes out?  Maybe a little arm soreness more than anything.  You wont be hyperextending your arm at all - and more of the pressure is in your shoulders really.  This last one - the 34 miles, hurt everywhere!!! Tonight was fish tacos....I liked it, DD liked it....hard to win over the men.  DH liked them enough, but DS moaned and moaned.  I think next time it will be shell fish and not swimming fish in the tacos - so son wont moan so much!!!  Have a great weekend!

Melanie - He is watching over you.  I know it.  You wouldnt have caught things so early and come so far without Him.  Your faith will get you the rest of the way.  Your dinner sounded great.  I like the simple things like that.  I can cook elaborately, but most of the time its simple baked or grilled things that really just do it for me! Maria - I hear ya on the clothes.  I had to buy two pairs of capris yesterday as the weather is supposed tobe in the 80s tomorrow.  I look like I am in clown pants when I try on last years stuff!!!  Good deals for you though!  Sometimes I just scour Goodwill for some of the more pricey brands....with no job, ya gotta do what ya gotta do.  But yesterday was 2 pairs of shoes and 2 pants at Khols.... Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 07:47PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi all!  A quick check in before bedtime.  My nephew is driving cross country and will pop in to spend the night tonight....But not sure if I will make it that long.  I think he is due after midnight.  DH can  handle it.  Its HIS sisters son afterall!  LOL Rennasus - glad you got a hike in!  And I AM SO GLAD the incision looks like it should be on its way now.  PHEW!!!!  Good of your PS to take it slowly.  It stinks when youre anxious but slow and steady wins the race.  At least that is what Ive always been taught! Red - congrats on the anniversary!!!  Wonderful!!!  And I am glad your fills are going well.  Sounds like we will end up about the same.  Ive been following your journey for so long....I feel like we are BC sisters.  I dont know for sure what my Uni side will be but it should be around a 450 if I get my way on the natural side.  I never thought I would be 450 but here I am almost there already and it feels great. Melanie that book is a super easy read....you should try again.  I have to admit that I never tried a recipe in there.  But having the structure of the snacking did it for me.  I went with a yogurt and berries in the morning snack and an apple and nuts in the afternoon and quit fried foods, soda and alcohol for a while and did the 30 minute walk....I dropped weight like that....and then added the zumba and biking to get the toning.  It feels great and wasnt hard at all.  Simple exchanges like using avocado instead of mayo on my burgers.....and less coffee...easy stuff. Maria - sorry about the rash!!! yes, keep us updated.  Good luck to DH on the interview!!!  and well, yes I am WEARING a C cup....but thats because a B is uncomfy.  I measure a B still....But they cut into me pretty quickly.... A C gives me a little room to be freer.  I dont fill it on the MX side because, well, of the shape and I have no nipple projection.  But its much more comfy.  I hope to be a C but at 415, well, a B will have to BE right now. What did I read on another thread, you lose about 50ccs with the implant?  So if I get another 80 and exchange, Ill be a little bigger than now at the end.  ok, I can handle that.  I just cant put any weight on or theyll disappear. No real news today.  I wish I got out to bike but spent the day cleaning the house!!! I hope either nephew  or my DH comes home soon because I am TIRED!!!!!  For dinner....easy peasy....bought a package of butterball turkey breast tenderloins and grilled them with salt and mesquite pepper and then we had those with assorted toppings (avocado, cranberry sauce, L&T, honey mustard, etc) on WW buns.  Wow I liked this even better than grilled chicken breasts.  We also had early corn and cole slaw.  Got to start making my own slaw but thats OK.  Everyone was happy with dinner.  Tomorrow depending on weather will be shrimp on the barbie over spinach salads or baked shrimp scampi. Have a great night!!!

Patti - take it easy...It IS hard to tell when youre at the threshold of overdoing it.  Listen to your body though...really. Red - how did the massage go?  I hate nerve damage.  I am getting to hate the words!!! Anniemom - at least you have a date now!  You can set your sights on it!!! Yeah I get it about going back to work but it will take your mind off of things and help you return to a sense of normalcy.  At least that is what I am hoping for!!! My BFF wants me to NOT jobhunt so I can be around to play...but I keep telling her that I need the mental stimulation as much as the rest.  Friday the 10th is my PREOP!!! Melanie - THERE you are!  Sorry about the hand...I hope it was more of a response to the heat.  Seems like you were able to take care of it rather quickly.  And yes, I DO have my date!  WOO HOO!  But unless I fly to San Anotnio, I dont think my PS will do my nipple before he moves.  I will have to see what this next PS will do before I decide. Tomorrow is supposed to be SO HOT that they have already called for an early dismissal at my son's school (only 1/2 of the building has climate control)...so I am going to help with the 5th grade farewell earlier than planned and then take him home at noon.  FINALLY Saturday I will be Zumbaing!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 11:27AM SuebeeBC wrote: Happy Friday!  I simply cannot believe this week is over already!!! Where did it go????  I helped at sons school all day today so didnt get out to exercise.  Ill walk the dog in a little bit here and then tomorrow is Zumba.  Its been a while since Ive ridden and I am getting anxious about that.  I know in a week and 1/2 I am back to restrictions!!!!  And back on my protein shakes! Barbara - I SWEAR I will not accuse you of boob greed!!!  I have to stop looking at my TE. In the next week I will want it bigger, or smaller, or lower or SOMEthing....I just have to trust that I liked the other side at 350 and will be going with that...if I dont stop, the greed will come back! I know with the way its sitting it looks so much more 'out there' than the implant will be so looks strangely huge on me.  In the end, I am just hoping for a full B and a small C would be nice.  (bigger than I was, but not looking like I had an augmentation except to people who have known me)  On another thread is a lady who has the same measurements as me and with her 450 implants, measures a 32DD!!!  Acutally I measured myself today and assuming my fluff is the same size, that is what I measure to....I laughed but I also know that THIS is not the 'final answer'  So go on with your bad self and get the rack you always wanted! Maria - and go on with YOUR bad self to the gym there!  I am sure you look WAY hotter than some of the young ones there.  I looked around Zumba one day and said "shoot I may be 44 and have a little mommy pouch in front but DANG I look good compared so SOME of these ladies!!!  I just wish my face match!  Ah a topic for another plastic surgery (kidding)!!! Awww shucks thanks for wanting to write to that hiring manager...thats sweet!!! Youre awesome!  And I DID change my profile pick to a Yellow Diamond Sign that says "under construction - check back soon".....only a handful of people will really get that one...but I thought it was so funny!!! Shannon at my lowest energy days, I still try to at least walk the dog and then go around the block again more briskly.  Even housework can keep your energy up...stick with it, I still have those days too. OH!  and Red - I kept the bathing suit!!!  I mentioned its a halter top tankini style.  It looked really nice 2 fills ago but the TE looks rediculous now.  I tried it on for DH and he said the suit looked ok (although does he HATE the 'how do I look' questions!) and when prodded a little further and begging for a real answer (playing the 'how much it cost' card) he said that it looked good enough on me NOW that I should keep the suit and expect it will look better when the exchange is done....so I thought at the very least that I will need a couple of styles of suit for various reasons...so I kept it. I am hoping by the end of July I am able to go in the water AND have a little drop and fluff.

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 10:38AM SuebeeBC wrote: Happy Monday everyone!  Its really amazing how checking in with you all has become a part of my day!!  So thanks for your compliments on the bikeride!  Its makes me feel good that I am accomplishing these rides.  My Odometer on my new bike is almost at 200 miles!!!!  Impressive since we bought the bikes in late March and it has rained nearly every day in April and 1/2 of May!!!  There were a couple of CHILLY rides in there!  Remember Ohio is pretty FLAT and has an EXCELLENT network of converted rail lines now...maybe the best in the country....so it so easy to get out to ride here!  The hardest part is getting back to my house from the trail (2 miles UP HILL the whole way) So call me crazy but I was REALLY itchy after grocery shopping this morning (My monday routine) that I went for ANOTHER ride!  Whew.  It was only 10 miles this time.  I just felt like I had a little energy to burn today.  Tomorrow is Zumba Toning too so I didnt want to do too much.  I was thinking of a ride on Wednesday but its supposed to be HOT and Friday is my pre-op Soooooo Im trying to plan out my last week of fitness! Im prepping for surgery food-wise too.  I didnt ask for meal delivery this time.  I set up my DH with 2 weeks of easy meals though (lean organic burgers, marinated chicken, sauces etc all in the freezer)...thank goodness its grill season!  The kids will be in camp that first week. Maria - YEAH on harnassing the boobs!!!  Id love to rock a bikini top but alas my Irish heritage makes me rather fair skinned and those belly stretch marks really show.  I wouldnt worry about 450's being a DD.  Im at 550 and I am ASSUMING that I am fluffing leftie approriately and measure the 32D (I miskeyed two D's).  On another thread, Firedancer is the same size as me and got 450's and she measures a 32DD because of the WIDTH of the implants fitting into an underwire....but she says she looks like a nice small C.  I am thinking finding 32DD bras would be a hard task!  Its funny that I would just go to the store and look for the smallest bra they had (sadly!) Rennasus - boring and repetitive updates are good!!!  Thats what I felt like for some time.  Im glad its stopped for now and hope its still dry!!! Anyway, hope you all have a great day....

Maria - its funny that I felt a little flattered and repulsed at the same time.  No one ever looked at my chest before!!!  And in Zumba class with all of that shimmying and wiggling....Phewey Im probably gettnig more looks than I realize.  Im not really busy looking around!! My 550 TE is on the picture forum.  Last photos before exhange.  WIth the exception of the sleeping issues and arm pain, I am adjusting to this size.  That has GOT to be the biggest downfall of overfilling the TE.  Im going to be sad to see the implants smaller!  Although with one natural girl, I hope I can remember from where I came!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 05:27AM SuebeeBC wrote: Goooood morning! Boy this is easier than the first time!  Its still rough but things like lifting my coffee cup, pulling up my pants and opening my protein shake bottles are much easier!!!  Thats because my right side (my dominant side) didnt have as much done to it this time.  I cant push the button to open the recliner though which is comical.  I texted my husband up in bed last night at 11pm to come down and open the recliner for me!!!  I was up every few hours last night but not uncomfortable at all.  I just have to try to remember to stand straight.  Its easy to hunch. Shannon - I have about 80% reach on the right and about 70 on the left I would say.  I will have no trouble washing my hair or even braiding it if I want.  I could reach for a glass in the cupboard last night!  So while the arm isnt behind my head, Im well on my way. Im not going to TRY to stretch at all until PS clears me though!!! Red - I have to wear the bra for 2 weeks and then can change to another sports bra if I want.  Its actually not bad.  Its a velcro front sports-bra-looking thing....and its very snug but I like it.  I feel all tucked in. Its just a little itchy in spots.  I am taking vicodin every 6 hours just like after MX.  I WOULD need the meds for sure.  PS doesnt want me on Motrin or anything over the counter for at least 4-5 days. Last time I was the hero and stopped pain meds during the day in 2 days and overnight at 5 days.  I think taking the vicodin for 5 days will make me sit still better and not feel like going for a run (or Zumba) like last time.  Lets promote the healing!  Im glad your PT is helping...phew. And dont you love hearing how skinny with no chest cushion we have?  LOL!!!  I dont mind the skinny but I was always sensitive about my little chest. Maria - I hope the job thing is resolved.  Look at all of the possibilities now!!! Hey and if you got Boston, I would get to see you because I grew up there and we are back there twice a year!  In fact I will get to meet another BC.org friend up there this summer!  So I vote Boston!  It is amazing how similar our journeys are.  I think youre all right that the DH's just dont know how to deal with things after a while and break down a little.  My poor DH had his mom on the brain too.  He questioned me talking to my friend so much about things once and I said "Look, If I want to talk about the pain in my boob for the 15th time in a week, my friend will listen every single time....do YOU want to hear it that much?"  He said "oh" and walked away. LOL.   I hope all of our S.O.'s come to understand the need of support from them, our friends, our BC friends and our neighbors.  It takes a village (but ultimately, it IS rather lonely....youre right Maria - but we need to keep reaching out!)

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 08:54AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi Everyone!!! I had my LAST appointment with my PS this morning!!!!     It was kinda sad.  He is SO happy with the exchange.  He said it doesnt get any better than I got it.  Then he suggested I put next to my photos "Not a typical patient....actual results may vary".  That made me feel good.  He was really happy I had my photos out there to show others my journey because it could give women hope, but at the same time it might raise some expectations.  We talked about all of the typical questions and then he made a referral to another doc out of house for the nipple in case the next doc I am uncomfortable with. So to answer those burning questions: Bra or no bra, my choice but dont buy anything expensive for 2 more months.  He said keep them supported in the day but the night is up to me and no wires yet.  I can swim!  I can start exercising slowly but no Zumba or biking if it strains the pecs.  No hot tub for a long time.  No need to Massage. Shannon- glad I could help with my little anecdote!  And I would go to the gym or bike or something one day a week.  Wear a large Tshirt so you feel less self-conscious.  I think the adrenaline will be better for you.  It will boost your mood! Melanie - yes the photo forum is that site I was saying.  Message Whippetmom, Timtam, Lilah, MBJ (I forget who else)....any one of those and say I referred you.  Youve been out here long enough that you dont need my referral anyway.  There are sections for rads, recons, and even hair.  Because I am a UNI and have a mammary fold incision on one side, I am not allowed wired bras.  I found some D's without wires at Khols....Lily of France.  I also have a Chantelle wirefree in a D.  But youre right, not easy to find!!! Maria - I want a super cute dress in the worst possible way!!! It may have to wait for drop and fluff.  Im curious to try on some old dresses I have that I didnt fill out before....hmmm.  Im just excited I can wear that swimsuit and get some USE of it this week!!!  Yippie!!!

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2011 04:11AM SuebeeBC wrote: Red - YEAH YEAH YEAH YEAH!!!!!!   Except for the nausea, sounds like everything went great!  I'm glad you got to come home and could settle in.  Remember when you take off that vest you might go "WHOA" with the swelling and taughtness of everything.  My first thought was "what did I DO???" - honestly I thought I was freakishly huge.  My best advice is something that has everyone chirps- be patient as they will change a LOT over the next few weeks.  Also remember to take it as EASY as you can until that first post-op appt.  The more you sleep and do nothing now, the faster you'll get back to it later!  Im so happy for you girlfriend!!!  welcome to the other side!!!!! Maria - You still have quite a lot going on!!!  But it sounds like you have a good handle on things right now which is great.  Happy Birthday to your mom!! How wonderful - mine would be 83 this year. I was far closer to my dad, but I miss her with every achievement my kids have.  I still wish i could pick up the phone and tell her about it! Barbara - I concur on the 'guns' - I wish I had them too!  Mine are more like bat wings.  Bah.  I need to ask for a trainer who knows what they are doing with breast cancer patients...I want to start working on my arms but I am SO afraid of hurting myself!!! Well, today we are going to a waterpark with the girls.  My DH does NOT want to go.  He was up 1/2 the night with allergies so he will be a peach going to a place he doesnt like on a day that its a zillion degrees. My challenge for the day is to make sure I dont go on any extreme waterslides or anything like that - this will be the first time for me in water since exchange.  PS (I almost wrote DPS LOL!!!) said I can swim but not all day long so Ill be going in, cooling off and standing waist high most of the day.  Ill try to only do the 'rides' on a tube so Im not crashing into the water.  I bet we stay no more than 3 hours either....its 'dangerously' hot here.  People arent used to it and there have been deaths. So for Shannon - my left side dropping...a little more description.  If you look at the profile of my photos, my breasts stick out a little like a cone.  If I took a photo now, my left side is starting to drop a little beyond the IMF....I cant hold a pencil yet, but its starting to look a little more like a real boob.  Does that make sense?  The fold is higher than the breast now. Have a great day everyone!

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 05:12PM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria I tend to agree - if I wait then I spend too much time thinking about possible ways I plan to say something, possibly replies, and possible retorts to those replies.  Its definitely my character flaw.....but melanie is right - the sooner the better. Men and boobs.  Yep they start as babies and never end their facination.  LOL  'cupcakes' lol - sounds like my DH. Melanie - holy crap what a time you have had!!!  I cant believe you went through all of that.  The best news of the day is 4 more days to go.  Then on to the healing!  Its sucky right now with the burnt skin and how you are feeling - but youre so close!!!  Shannon - I know I'm going to get it for saying this....but I still think they are small and barely noticable.  THERE I said it.  And this is coming from a woman who always wore a padded bra before and still couldnt fill an A cup.  I dont know how or why I feel this way but i really wouldnt mind it if I went larger! So today BC came and gave me a reality smack.  Into the library walks this beautiful older lady and before she walked all of the way in the door I thought to myself 'breast cancer'. I dont know how I knew but then she turned and was not reconstructed.  Then it was confirmed.  I have BRCA-dar!  What the heck???  She wore gloves the whole time she was in there (rubber gloves) and took out a dozen or more movies and books - and when she checked out, her record said that she wouldnt be billed any overdue fines at all until her treatments were finished.  She was so pleasant and personable.....I wanted to say something - like reach out (because thats the sort of town and library I work at....everyone asks me my name there because Im new) but I didnt.  Maybe if she comes in weekly and I get to know her and it comes up....but its so weird how I wanted to make that connection.

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 05:20AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hello Sorry to those having difficulties right now.  All I can say is that we have all had our fair share and it DOES get better.  But its also critical to keep open dialogue with your surgeons if something doesnt feel right.  Any good surgeon would rather all of the little "is this OK' questions than you ignore a symptom that could be something larger.  If your PS or BS doesnt at least have a nurse on hand who can answer these calls, its time to think about another surgeon.  I'm living in flux right now as my DPS (DEAREST Plastic Surgeon)  moved away and my NPS (Newbie Plastic Surgeon) isnt up to speed yet so I hope my little questions are just normal things- but if I get bothered at all, Ill be calling! Maria and Red - yeah vacations!  Im happy for you both to get a llittle break from things.  Red - 2 and 1/2 weeks out of surgery is where I was when we went to Boston.  I walked a TON but I didnt go into the water or go boating, I took pics from the shore.  I was just not comfortable with the pec muscles yet and even gentle arm movements in the water are felt - even a month and 1/2 out.  While your vacation will be wonderful - still stay within your boundaries right now! Im 7 weeks post exchange today.  I was going to wait until September, when the kids are back to school, to go for my nordies fitting....but I think I want to shoot for next week now.  I'll be 2 months out.  Looking at other photos, I can see my medial space is really still little.  I can 'push' my right implant out a little, but my point is, when I am sleeping in my sports bra (a compression style - the FOTL one) it is NOT helping keeping them apart.  When I sleep without, the space is much better defined.  So I need bras that encapsulate the breasts better. I really only have the Lily and the Chantelle right now that do that...the VS ones push in.  The Chantelle I cant really wear in the summer beause of the soft cups (the lack of nipple is OBVIOUS.).  Sleeping without a bra helps the spot that is usually sore in the morning, Anyway, Im not complaining, just letting you all know some of the things to look out for. Today Im headed to the waterpark with my kids and my neighbor and her daughter.  Just for a few hours.  DH is off golfing.  Have a great day!!!

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 06:47PM SuebeeBC wrote: Marie - Follow your PS's advice.  Mine doesnt want me running. I bike and do Zumba with a VERY snug sports bra.  I wasnt allowed to bike (even stationary) for 6-8 weeks post MX though.  I could do it slowly and as long as I didnt aggravate the pecs at 2 weeks post exchange. What about a recumbant stationary bike?  I would start with that and power walking (try not to move your arms much - keep them tight to you).  After your legs feel better you might try a light jog or walking with small weights.  I would NOT lift or try to swim yet.  Its still early days.  Swimming aggravates me 2 months after exchange. But first and foremost talk to your PS and be honest about what you WANT to do instead of asking what you CAN do.  For example if he says you can go to the gym, he may not be thinking that youre planning on running the track, weight lifting and swimming.....he might be thinking youre doing leg machines or the stationary bike....so be specific.

Barbara - yes the PS appt was a little bit of a mind screw...just when you get to the point where your satisfied someone says 'yes I can fix that' - fix what?  I thought I was fine???  Its like being a teenager and some stupid boy says 'your nose is big' and you spend the rest of the day looking in the mirror and asking everyone you know if your nose is big.  LOL.  My scar IS a lot bigger than DPS said it would be.  I kept that dermabond on there for 6 whole weeks (longer than 10 days!!!) so my scar would be teenie and no such luck. Renn - we are here for you!!!  Where are my pom-poms?  ;-) NPS suggested a bandeau (did I say this before) to aid the right one down.  I have read mixed reviews on this - some PSs feel that the pocket is where its at and a bandeau wont help the breast drop.  Good news is that NPS will MAKE me one so I dont have to buy one....but I have to wait until Tuesday.  And Jan not dropping wont postpone the nipple.  I asked that one.  She may never drop....remember I had like negative A's before....my poor skin has been stretched so far to get my lovely D's.  Its so thin that its discolored in the middle.  I have to give this poor girl a break.  I wont be making any porn flicks in my future - ill just have to get over that.

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 04:29AM - edited Sep 28, 2011 05:11AM by SuebeeBC Maria I feel the same way about OHIO!!!  When I go to the base gym, they are all military so mostly on the fitter/smaller side.  But the women I see at the public gym or who walk into the lilbrary?  Holy cow!  But then, I think they are all German farmers here or something. (BTW, not a slam - my dad's mom and sister, german heritage, VERY large women....to see my mom standing next to them was a riot - her being a teenie Irish lady). We would have serious complications if we tried to compete with them breast wise.  Our frames couldnt handle it.  I may be a DD - but if I had a 38 inch ribcage, they would be only an A so maybe the women you see really are DD's themselves?  And that thin lady with the big ones?  Well, I think she probably hates them and feels like they are in the way!  Now don't you get all obsessed watching boobs in your classes!!!  I watch mine when I am in the mirror (are they moving ok?  Do they look 'right'?) and then I see myself watching some of the young ones because mine look more like those than the ones my age! And youre right - DH loves them - I feel like I look SO much better in clothes, and I do NOT want to run the risk of losing the implant or having complications after yet another surgery!  Red reminded me that some women have revisions down the road - and the implants will need to be changed in 10 years anyway - so if I want a new size then, I can do that.  BTW, caught DH talking to them today....I laughed at him and bent down so he could talk to my face.  I guess my top is low cut today!

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 03:24PM SuebeeBC wrote: Ahhh fall!  Good times!  But at 45 degrees its a little TOO fall for me!!!  Tomorrow for dinner we are having a traditional New England Boiled Dinner.  mmmmm. And I think I may make a vegetable curry with the cauliflower, garbanzo beans, broccoli, peas and other such things laying around...for a side dish during the week. There is a powerful chemical in curry that may ward off colon cancer - good news - and after the years in Japan we are all adapted to that flavor well.  I often mix curry in my chicken salad (with grapes and walnuts) for a power-wrap. The slow cooker is back out and I plan to do a slow cook meal on Tuesdays because I work so late.  I think its some new chicken dish this week.  Now that fall is here and school is back in session, I get more standard with the meals....Sunday is big roast day (so I can use the leftovers in something else)...Then I have a soup day, a pasta day, a slow cooker day, a 'new recipe' day, and a super easy day (breakfast for dinner, some kind of sandwich, or pizza)...recipes are dependent on what is in the freezer. I also just picked up this cookbook that shows you how to make meals for the freezer. Im going to look into that since DH has to be responsible for dinner twice a week now. As for exercise....I'm out.  Boo.  I felt like I was really shaping up and now I am out for at least 2 weeks if I want to keep my little nubbie safe and sound.  Ill get back there though.  Sigh, I never thought I would be jealous of you all getting out to exercise!

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2011 11:00AM SuebeeBC wrote: Barbara excellent question!!!  We are beef eaters here too.  In the summer we eat beef probably 3-4 times a week because of the grill....fajitas, kabobs, steaks, hamburgers.  I dont like to cook inside during July and August. It DOES get expensive, but I do buy organic grass fed meets.  I always scour the freezer section because there are meats that are frozen before their 'sell by' date and offered at 1/2 price.  That helps a lot with the more expensive cuts.  Buying the family packs are always an excellent idea too.  In the winter we are down to only once or twice a week of the beef.  Chickens here come from the Amish farms which are organic, grain fed.  I dont buy much pork. I am helpless with 'fish that swim' at home so if I cook with fish, its ALWAYS shellfish.....I dont know why I have horrible fish skills! That being said, we dont eat out much at all....when I do, its fish!  We are always eating sushi or salmon when at a restaurant.  We arent perfect, we order Papa Johns once a month probably and we DO love bangers and mash...Im working on better options here.  Nitrate free, organic, etc. I have a catalog of options if its chicken day and I peek into the freezer....I try to keep ingredients on hand and I always have a soup and my spaghetti sauces in the freezer for easy ideas.  Thats what I do on sundays!  I try to cook something once a week that 1/2 of it can go into the freezer for another day....so 2 lasagnas, a soup, chili, baked ziti....that kind of thing.  Aaaaaannnd - I have a meal calendar on the fridge - I would love to do a month but right now I do 2 weeks at a time....planning and shopping based on whats on hand.  I always did a week at a time for effective grocery shopping, but with work, I try to do two weeks.  I tried a month and failed miserably!!! Sooooo frustrated its going to be in the mid-to-upper 70s all week and I CANT RIDE!!!!  I see PS tomorrow for stitches...maybe I can feel her out on this exercise thing.

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 04:05PM SuebeeBC wrote: Back to report on the "Lighter Shrimp Scampi"....everyone ate every bit and wanted more.  I think that means it was a hit.  This is a recipe from Food.com.  Ill write the recipe as written and then put in parenthesis what I did..... 1 1/2 pounds large raw shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails left on, pat dry (I had only a 1 pound bag - wish I had more) 1 tablespoon Olive Oil (I used a little more than 2) 2 garlic cloves minced (I doubled this as we love garlic) S&P 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes (I didnt have so used 2 dashes chipotle pepper) 2 tablespoonds fresh lemon juice 1. Set Broiler rack 4 inches from heat. 2. Place shrimp in large 9x13 glass baking dish. 3. Sprinkle with oil and garlic and generously with S&P. Add red pepper flakes. Toss to coat.  Arrange in a single layer. 4. Broil 3-4 minutes until opaque throughout.  Sprinkle with lemon juice, toss to combine.  Serve Immediately. Now, in step number 4, I tossed with a package of quinoa pasta, a cup of peas (cooked with the pasta), and two chopped vine ripe tomatoes.  Thats why I added the extra oil and garlic. It is GONE.....I did miss the butter a lot but I liked the quinoa pasta substitution.  I think it might need a little more seasoning perhaps?  Not so much hot though. Thats the recipe for the day!  enjoy!!!

Thanks for the bra suggestions....I was JUST at Khols too!!!  Ill have to write that down and see how I do tomorrow with the fill.  This size/fluffing thing will be for only 3 weeks....I can do it, right?  Ill die if I have to wait longer though!...especially being from MA I cant take the heat - its 75 here now and I am in shorts...my brand NEW shorts.  I havent worn shorts since we lived in Hawaii and then it was knee length!!!  That is a little cheer for today!!!  More good news - I bought a bathing suit today too!!!  and I LIKE IT!!!! It is a tankini and the top is halter style....yes you can see my 1/2 cleave but its OK for now.  Its good if I get asked to hot tub at BFFs house but I wont wear it swimming until I have a full chest. One MORE bit of good news today....the library job I interviewed for?  Well, they chose someone else.  Boo.  HOWEVER they were so impressed that they asked me to be a 'substitute associate" on reference - at 1 and 1/2 times the salary of the other job I applied for!  This means the work wont be consistant which is a HUGE drag, but the point is, I could work at any of the libraries in the area, I would be IN the system and hopefully the first person they turn to when it comes time for a full time permanant slot.  So I will have to continue my search for a job, but this means I have my foot in the door somewhere!!!!

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 11:56AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good afternoon all!  Well, my pain is still evident today but I took only motrin this morning and none since so that is a step forward.  I will take a precautionary vicodin tonight I think but I dont want to take more than I need.  Im also coming to grips with the PS deal.  If I have to wait, well Ill have to wait....he is very confident I am going to get a great result....he keeps telling me.  Ill have to believe it will be worth the wait if it comes to that. Maria - glad the port is OUT!  Yeah! what a relief.  And the turkey tacos sound great! Anniemom - I hope they dont delay you too but with my new attitude, know that any delay is for your safety and for a better result, not to piss you off!!!  I have low iron too but its due to a genetic trait  so I do not have to take suppliments....but an unsuspecting doc can raise an eyebrow over it as its not a really well known thing.  Let us know how it goes!!!!! Red - I hope your mom fares well with chemo.  It can be a blessing and a curse.  I tried to take some pix today but am a little embarrased by my lack of fluffing symmetry.  Ill keep trying. Maria - thats how I have been feeling when I bike - so heavy.  Its the lack of consistant exercise right now with the exception of walking.  I feel horrible about it but I HAVE to do whats right for this TE side right now.  I want to bike so badly and hope to get a ride in this weekend and maybe zumba! Well, I have a new problem!  My SHIRTS dont FIT!!!!  I tried on my rather new exercise shirts today and they do NOT look good on anymore.  My foobs have completely exploded! LOL at least thats what it feels like. I get rippling across the front of the shirt now.  Ill hang onto them though because once I have the exchange and they drop and fluff, I think they wont be so "OUT THERE".  I dont know what I am going to wear this summer now!!!  My old 'fat' shirts I can wear and fill out now LOL but they are lower cut and my upper pole really shows.  What a bizaare new problem to have!!!

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 10:11AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey Gals - Happy Tuesday!!! I HAVE AN E-DAY!!!!!!  I am so excited I cannot possibly STAND IT!!!  I had my PS appointment today and somewhere in the heavens is someone I owe a VERY big favor to (or someone in the Military, not sure) but my PS's move date was moved to AUGUST!!!  YIPPIE!!!!!!  So we tried on implants on the left AGAIN.....and he put a little fill - not much, just a top off....and said "How's June 13th for you??" YEAH!!!  So he will augment the left with a 350 and then bring in several implants to match the right.  We discussed that the TE is higher than the natural and he explained how he will even them out.  Red - I am so glad I was able to motivate you to get out biking!  Thats great!  I wish I could bike more right now but it seems like there is something every day around here!  Interesting you have trouble with some exercises.  My main issue is the TE pressing on the side of my arm which gives me arm pain..thats the drag with biking.  But stretching and abs (at least in Zumba) seem ok to me. Maria - Glad Chicago was awesome and thanks for the hotel tip!  We'll have to get up there soon.  We have been looking for some fun ideas that wont break the bank.  Of course I want to go to Florida but that doesnt exactly fit the 'cheap vacation' plan.  LOL.  Once we have jobs, then we will have the money but wont have the TIME!!!  As for Zumba - I will probably go on Saturday this week.  Today was out and I think I may try to bike a short distance tomorrow.  My kids are in their last two weeks of school and I am helping out nearly every day up there.  That cuts in to exercise time!!! Rehm and Shannon welcome!  Zumba has been great for me because I can isolate certain areas and only use the one arm (I had a Uni) when I was comfortable.  I did it a lot before surgery and my strong legs and abs certainly helped recovery.  The only thing my PS said not to do was run.  I wasnt given stretches either but told to move normally....so I do.  I still reach for things in my cupboards, stretch a lttle in the shower and do my Zumba twice a week.  I also do normal things like keep my arm up and behind my head when I watch TV.

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 12:52PM SuebeeBC wrote: Gosh Renn I am so sorry about your BFF's Dad!!!  Losing a parent is so difficult at any age.  And I can imagine your desire to 'be there' for her.    I know she knows your intent however and knows she is well supported by you in the best way you can be right now. Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 05:24AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Sunday to you all!  I cant believe my exchange is one week from tomorrow already.  Holy CRAP!  I was saying on another thread that I cant keep my hand off it, cant stop looking at it, and cant stop MEASURING myself!!!  I am going to lose it!  LOL  NOT THAT I AM GETTING BOOB GREED, but I keep looking and wondering if I am doing the right thing with the size.  DH thinks I shouldnt go bigger (I look rather 'out there' now but I am overexpanded and it IS a TE afterall).  Ah just the self doubt settling in! Barbara- glad you got out on the horse!  Dang, it was almost as hot here in OHIO as there yesterday!!!!  It was still 91 at nighttime.  Strangely hot for this time of year and where we are.  I'm really excited for you and your trip.  And a little jealous!!! Red - glad you found a suit that works!  Yippie!  With my ONE boob, I dont think swimming would be feasible but I just have to make it through the next month I hope! My kids are done with school this friday.  I am so not ready!!! Renna - sorry youre feeling sluggish...Did you hear the news about the anti-breast cancer drug that gets higher marks than Tamox?  No side effects and 65% reduction of risk?  They are looking to give it to high risk women before diagnosis...I wonder how long it would take before its common practice?  I would take it for a 65% chance of reduction and no SE's..... So Zumba yesterday was HARD for me.  My arm was very tight and sore.  I tried to avoid shimmies and throwing my arms up. My face was SO RED but I think it was the heat yesterday.  I am going to try Zumba at least twice this week before I am done for the summer.  Id like to bike today before it gets too sunny and hot.  Not to bury the news here but my MIL passed this morning.  My DH mustve gotten a 4am call or something because it was his FB status (he is still asleep) and he didnt wake me to tell me.  So instead of heading out on a ride, I am going to wait until he gets up.  He may want a family ride today.  There will be a memorial service when everyone can (no wake or funeral)...with my surgery next week, I think it will probably be ina couple weeks when I am OK to drive that far. Sigh.  While she was never 'MY' mom, she was a good lady and a good mother in law.

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 04:05AM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria - Girlfriend you are all good.  I echo what Rennasus says.  You have done alot, been through a lot and deal with a lot.  Your feelings ARE absolutely normal!  The best advice I have is to take a DEEP BREATH and know that you wont feel this way in a week or a month....its just everything at once.  You will get through!!!!  I know it!  I am willing to bet we ALL have been there at one point through this. And Im glad to know that Im not the only one with curious friends....My BFF touched my TE right after surgery and my neighbor touched it a few weeks ago.  I dont feel it so I dont care.  LOL.  Just the openess of the grabbing and the conversation is crazy!  Never thought!!! Shannon I think I think about boobs as much as a teenage boy right now....obsess away!!!  LOL.  I look at everyones boobs, judging size and comparing.  I crack up. Well, today is National Best Friends Day so I am taking my daughter and her 3 neighborhood BFF's out for donuts before school.  My son has something going at school every day so I thought this would be fun for the girls.  My BFF is coming too (her daughter is my daughters best friend) so that will be fun.  So I gotta go get ready!!! Ill talk to you later!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 11:49AM SuebeeBC wrote: Thanks Rennasus! Some of the common ones we use here are MX for mastectomy - UMX or BMX for uni or bi.  DH is Dear Husband....think DS, DD, DP for son, daughter, poochie, etc...look at context.  LOL is laughing.  BFF is Best Friend.  TX for Tamoxifen.  PS for plastic surgeon, ONC for Oncologist.  BC for Breast Cancer and BS for Breast Surgeon.  A lot of them make sense once you catch on to a couple. Maria - I still say all is good.  I remember my really bad April meltdown.  I never did tell my BFF that I was totally mad at her all wrapped up into everything else.  I just hope that it was a really bad time and whatever I was mad at her for was because of everything else exploding.  And YEP - BOOBS ON THE BRAIN - all day and all night.  We took the girls out for donuts and then talked about boobs again.  Bless her for playing along.  I was telling her that I felt 'looked at' in Zumba this last time (There is an older gentleman who overly-compliments me and yesterday actually ASKED to read the writing on my shirt???  Come on!!! - and my instructor is a guy and while I was doing a chest thrusting move, I caught him looking)...so I guess that is my new normal unless the projection Ive got goes way down!!!  I gave her a hug and bonked her bad with my TE.  Ouch.  She just said "um, that was hard."  Sorry!  How was your workout? AND your PRE-OP????   Im off today.....I did Sat, Sun, Mon and Tue so I have to take today off to recover.  Its hot too....maybe a ride Friday after my pre-op. Melanie - next phase.  33 treatments?  I hope this next phase passes really quickly.  Youve been through a lot too.  I dont think how youre feeling right now is 'the rest of your life'.  But it IS hard right now.  Bless you.  Youll get through. Shannon - ooooh teens.  I have one and a pre-teen.  Thank GOD I am not in the throes of anything too bad with them right now.  Friday is the first day of summer vacation though!  Oy! Rennasus - I read on another thread about your incisions.  Come on....COME ON!!  I feel like a little far away cheerleader.  Almost there!!! And Stay tuned to see how the second round goes with me!  with one incision underneath and one across, I am so curious to see if I have the same issues.  Ill tell you though, I plan on NOT MOVING those first two weeks at all!  No Wii Zumba this time (that was so DUMB)...and if I have to drive.....well, maybe Ill have DH drive me.  I cant have issues this time!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2011 01:19PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi Ladies....Youre the bomb!  I really HAVE been dwelling on my friend again.  Sheesh if she doesnt kill this friendship, I will!!!  Just with all my conjuring up issues.  Stop it! Stop dwelling!  I think the neighborhood gals are all just busy with their kids now that school is out.  No one offered a meal this time.  That blew me away.  No one asked what we are doing with our kids on the day of surgery.  No one offered playdates or anything.  And only one person asked me what time my surgery was....and I pulled up to her house to chat the other day!  I really think they dont get it. Shannon- I will be NOT sleeping WITH my arms over my head on Sunday!  LOL _ now I think of you when my arms are up!  Anniemom - YIKES you sound busy girl!  It will make the time go that much faster!!!  I AM so very glad to see you back on the boards however!!! Renn  - ya know what I want?  A visit.  My DH can handle the meals and kids since he isnt working right now so all good.  But I would just love my GF's to stop by and have lunch with me!!!  Thats it!!!  Last time I wanted only my BFF to visit and she dropped the ball - she came by twice for about 10 minutes (and acted like she had to be somewhere else) and then got so sick that I didnt see her for a month.  Maybe that is festering with me....because she said she was going to be by my side every day for lunch that first week.  At least this time she didnt promise anything! Zumba was great today - my instructor bought me a Zumba shirt to wear during recovery so I would think of them.   Awwwwwwww.....I love them! Oh and I have my secret surprise I want to share...I havent shared with anyone!!!  Ya know how we love to compare our TEs with baseballs, or cannonballs or coconuts etc?  Well, weeks back my friend went to Hawaii and DH joked that she should bring back a coconut bra for me (which I would have NEVER worn when we lived there).....well, I didnt ask her...but I DID buy one at the local party store and stashed it away for when I am completely healed...as a surprise treat for him.  I did something fun for him the last night before MX (he was completely delighted with THAT surprise) and I thought this would be a funny conclusion.  I just remembered today that I had that!!!  LOL

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2011 07:14AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey gals!  Happy Friday!!! That must mean Day 5 for me!  Time to wean off the pain meds!  Now comes the hard part.  I resisted the urge to walk last night.  I slept in the recliner again but mainly that was because my stomach was a mess last night.  The pain meds back you up horribly.  I took a prescription constipation med and in an hour was cramping and feeling, well, like you-know-what.  I forgot how poorly those const. meds made me feel last time...and it was why I went of the vicodin so fast. I took my second shower today too....Shannon you have to know that as much as I HATED that TE and was really hurting up to my surgery - I love the new girls.  I think they look just great.  I think I went with the right size for me...I told DH that I dont think I shouldve gone bigger or smaller.  So there is HOPE for you!!! I just KNOW IT!!! Shannon - the kickstand thing is the perfect analogy!!! I had to tuck a pillow under my ribs to keep from putting pressure on my TE.  I was laughing reading that one!  Do you have a recliner or other room you can escape to?  When we bought our house, the 4th bedroom was mandatory for just those occasions!  I hope you report back after your appt this morning!!! Maria - Ummm, YEAH on the visit!!!!  That would be AWESOME!!!  Let me know how plans start to form!  We are less than an hour to Cincy.  And surgery NEXT WEEK!!!  YEEE-HAW!!!  I am so excited for you!  The meal prep I did is really working out nicely right now.  DH is doing great. I feel like I will be back in the saddle sooner than 3 weeks but Im glad I prepared for that.  I think we are leaving for MA in less than 2 weeks so Ill be able to eat a LOT of fish soon! Father's Day - well, we dont have local friends we could BBQ with sadly...I think that is one of the things in life I really wish I had.  My daughter will be in TN on a mission trip (her first time) and I will still be laid up so I bet we'll have a low key day.
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2011 07:10AM SuebeeBC wrote: Lots to catch up on!!!  Poor DH had danish and a coffee in bed today because thats all I could muster.  I wouldve done eggs but I am FORCING myself to not do stuff like that.  It was at 10 days out last time that I wiped down the kitchen (because I couldnt STAND it anymore) and dusted when my incision opened. Julie -  I have colace but it wasnt slow for me!!!  I got cramping in an hour and sat writhing on the stool within 2.  Now that I am OFF the vicodin in the day (and soon at night), coffee is my perfect stool softener.  After both surgeries, I didnt mind the constipation for abotu 3 days and then started getting tummy issues.  So Id rather go off the pain meds at that point than deal with tummy troubles.  But maria is right, there are others here that can help with the chemo issues. Maria - I wonder and worry about Adam on Man V Food!!! I dont know how he does it.  Well, he isnt Mr Universe.  Youll have plenty of time for food shows soon!!!  And I agree about the photos.  OMG I think months ago I shared my Onsen story from when we lived in Japan.  My boobs made me so ashamed of myself because it seemed everyone had a comment about my size before that I couldnt go do a traditional onsen with my Japanese friends....even though I know they were all as flat as I was.  Now I feel like flashing everyone!!!  I just hope Im not obnoxious with my clothing choices!! Ill have to revisit the xanax thing....I slept in a bed lat night! YEAH!  It was WORK however!  I took a vicodin before bed, propped my back so I wouldnt roll over and put the corner of another pillow under my ribs so I could be ALMOST on my side...I woke once at about 1:30 and thought about moving but hung on there.  I was thinking that I HAD to get used to the bed because soon I would be in hotels.  I guess my pillows are coming on vacation! Maria I hope your job stress comes to a peaceful conclusion soon.  Having moved because of DH's work 4 times to VERY unknown places, I can totally relate to the waiting and hoping and dreading. Vent away.  For me, school districts have always been number one when considering where to live. Let me know if you need help with how I did research.  And my 2 cents??? since you didnt ask for it!!  ;-)  I ALWAYS voted for adventure.  My kids are so iincredible now having had the experiences they have had.  I would still vote for another adventure assigment if my husband got it....this stable thing isnt working for me!  LOL!!! OK, Im going to shower and wash my bra - yippie what a great father's day!!!  LOL.

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2011 08:09AM SuebeeBC wrote: Oh one more thing....I probably dont have to tell you this one, Maria....but I find myself far less interested in food this time.  I didnt realize it was a side effect from the antibiotics I am taking.  I just wanted to let you know to have some quick grabs available...fruit, ww toast, nuts, yogurts, etc.  I sit at the dinner table and eat 1/2 of what I normally would and then find myself forcing a little more salad in cuz I know I need the nutrients. And wow my boobs look different already. I have bruising ALL around the edge of the pocket thats totally yellow now...and my left projects a lot more than my right.  The incision on the right looks better than the left however.  And they are SO NOT as big as the TE at all.  It will be fun to see how things keep changing!

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2011 04:42AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Morning!  My first thought today was 'Maria's on her way!!!'  Yippie!  Maria - I know you wont see this until youre dont but I am sure your correction will be great.  Remember that as a Uni, my TE was an inch higher than my natural one.  PS gave me a 1/2 in lift on one side and lowered my pocket a 1/2 inch to meet her.  You've seenn the results, symmetry IS possible, even in a uni!!! Melanie - I always had a love of the library - but I wasnt really allowed to ever want to be a librarian.  I went to a very stuffy college prepatory high school and everyone was going to be a doctor or lawyer (it seemed) so the pressure was on me to pick a good college and career.  I went into Computer Science because it literally was the only other thing I had an affinity for (It was the 80's - big technical boom) and did it for 10 years.  But I am definitely a data person....I am terrible at networks, hardware etc....so now that I can start NEW (now that we are settling here, wont move again and my kids are older), I thought I would follow my heart this time.   I have time to develop and grow here now.  Its part of why I took the entry level position.  I know I am far more qualified for Research Librarian, but I know I have time.    My point is...in my 20's, I did what I HAD to do.....now in my 40's Im going to do what I WANT to do!!! If its something you want to try, GO FOR IT!  No day but today! And Im really quite shocked that you get ASKED if your boobs are real!!!!  OMG! Id have a FIT!  Even with my TE no one asked me...Just at my last neighborhood lunch did my friends kinda stare at it but they knew what was going on (and it was twice as big as the last time they had seen it).  Have you seen the Tshirt that says "Yes, they're FAKE, my real ones tried to KILL ME!"  I was thinking of getting that shirt for my first time back at Zumba.  That would answer any questions. Annie - Time to take a typing class to maximize your time online then!!!!  We miss seeing you more often but glad you get to check in!!! Have a great Day!!!  I am off to VS to return the C's I bought and try on a D.  This is ONE time I wish the swelling on my body would NOT go down!!!!  Im loving my boobies the way they are!!!
Posts.Title: Jan 2011 gals - post op exercise check in! mdg redskyatnight

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2011 07:29AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Morning!!!! Can I exercise now?  UGH its been perfect biking weather here!  I sat at the baseball games this week looking past the fields as my bike trail runs behind it.  I was watching solo bikers, couples, families all gliding by.  Was there a game going on?  LOL.  Today is day 14.  Can you believe that???  I have them loose today and they feel great.  Sensitive on the left and my nip is pointing up for some weird reason, but the right's swelling is way down and soft. I'm keeping up with the protein,fruit, veg and vitamins.  I see PS on Tuesday and I cant wait to ask a zillion questions! And I have a friend update. So Thursday I get my check-in text (cuz that seems to be all we have left).  She sounded excited and upbeat and it ended with "I will call you tomorrow - I have so much to tell you!!!" OK, so do I get a call on Friday?  So a little temporary insanity mixed with a dash of pissed off, I text her Friday night saying something to the effect of "So you give my that kind of teaser and dont followup with a call to tell me whats up? Whats going on?"  No text or call.  And yesterday my DH saw her at the ball field (I had left by then) where she was watching her son's practice and she tells DH that she misses me.  REALLY.  Sorry but now Im aggravated.  If I tell anyone "Ill call you later." or "call you tomorrow" or "Ill call you right back"....I do precisely that.  But for her any of those means the same thing...Ill call SOMEday but no idea when!  Grrrrrrrr.  I know it sounds petty to be bitching about a phone call but its like an emotional push and pull we have going on.   You all dont need to say anything at all....that was mostly to get it off my chest because my DH is tired of hearing me moan about her. So the good news in all of this is that I have a crazy busy week and then I am on VACATION!!!  Baseball games, appointments, parties, packing until wednesday and then we drive away!  I am so happy to blow this clambake. (Well, thats kind of a New England expression - and it doesnt make sense since I am trying to GET to a clambake)  Since the sun didnt bother me yesterday at all, we are making plans for the beach up in MA/NH  for a couple of days.  YEAH!  I will be on Omega 3 overload....Fish for lunch and dinner every day!!! Whew this post was ME, ME, ME today.  Sorry about that. I hope you all have a GREAT day and are doing well.  Thinking of my sistas out here!!!

Renn - DPS=GPS You are so funny!!! - like my Tom Tom....he is my Mike Mike!!!  I didnt have PT but will inquire when I make my 6 month appt with BS (I cant believe its 6 months TODAY that I had my surgery!!!!)  I also need to make all of my appointments - BS, PS, Mammo, Gyno.  UGH.  I dont know if she'll give me PT...I still have that intermittant arm pain which I THOUGHT went away after exchange but Im going to talk about my ROM on my right side and the tightness in my drain site.  I really want to find a good Trainer who can help me get some arms going but I doubt the ones at the base gyms are trained to help BC patients. Melanie - YEAH on the 5'Oclock shadow!!!!  AND youre almost done with Rads!!! I am so happy for you!  Shannon - I hope you get a chance to meet Barbara!!!!  Meeting Firedancer was such a blessing.  To sit with someone who knows all of the backstory AND who has been there is amazing.  We couldve talked all day.  We could talk about our ordeals without feeling like we were taking up too much of the others time or complaining or any other feeling I get when I mention anything to my non-BC friends.  And there was no awkwardness of meeting someone for the first time either.  It was strange but wonderful and always memorable!!!  Ooops I just realized I didnt take pix yesterday....my DH mentioned it twice too.  He is really getting to LOVE taking pix.  LOL. We've been having a little too much together time though - Im ready for him to work!  Well, my dermabond on my MX side started cracking a few weeks ago, and last night I took off a small chunk - maybe 1/5 of the whole thing.  If you dont have dermabond, its just like crazy glue  - so you can imagine it trapped any little drops of blood at the time of surgery and sticks like crazy until the your skin starts to regenerate and then it peels right off.  But when it comes off, the skin is moist and red like youve had a bandaid on a wound for a long time, so then I get all worried looking at it like "is it closed? is it seeping?" because of last time.  Of course its closed.  The dermabond held for 6 weeks - last time it held for 10 days.  But I am BABYing the area so like a mama, I worry about my girl!  The scar will be minimal when it all comes off I think (hope!) Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 06:53PM SuebeeBC wrote: Red - I would call your PS too.  Surely by now you could be on your side.  Are you commando at night?  You could try a modified side position where youre on your side but have a small pillow (not a bed pillow but something small  - a folded towel or even one of your daughter's teddy bears) under your ribs (not your breast area but lower than that).  That will keep you from being COMPLETELY on your side...no pressure on the pockets at all.  I did that for my entire Kick Stand time and for almost 3 weeks post exchange.  Now I am without any extra pillow at all.  I didnt get any guideline on HOW to sleep in bed...I just got 'sleep in the recliner for a couple of days'.....and 'you dont need to sleep in a bra'.....which I did anyway for about 5 or 6 weeks...,THAT kept the pockets in tact I think.

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 11:55AM SuebeeBC wrote: Barbara - I dont track anymore.  I did when I started because I was just walking at that time. Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 02:39PM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria - we are having turkey tortilla soup tonight.  It was great to find this recipe when I was trying to lose weight.  I would make a pot on Monday and eat it for lunch all week.  Leftover chicken or turkey, tomatos (antioxidents), black beans (fiber), corn, quinoa or red rice depending on my mood and a low sodium broth.  I am send the recipe if you want.  It also freezes well in two batches for dinners and even my picky son loves it. For the 5 a day.....I would have a banana in the morning right after my walk because I found I was getting leg twitches (potassium deficiency) and the banana helpes right away.  For mid-morning snack blueberries on my yogurt.  Afternoon snack is always an apple and nuts (fiber and protien) and then I find it easy to get two veggies in at dinner.  My problem in winter is the water.  I know I need it!  I probably get 4-6 instead of 8 but I make up for it the rest of the year for sure.  I need to work on that!

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2011 04:51PM SuebeeBC wrote: Annie, zumba is a fitness class set to latin music!  The range of difficulty varies wildly depending on the instructor.  I went 3x a week from June to January - one class was fairly easy (after a time I could do a lot more with my wiggling, hopping, etc to make it more of a workout), one class was tough but very enjoyable, and one was something called Zumba toning - less dance but with weights).  And thats all the same instructor - sometimes I try different teachers and either hyperventalate or say 'nope, too easy'.  I am competely addicted.  They say the more you do it, the more calories you burn...anywhere from 300-1000 calories depending on your level.  Judging how the weight fell off of me, Im guessing I was in the middle. Look it up....you never know, you might love it!  Its like a party!

Oh and BFF called today...we had a fantastic chat and I feel SO much better.  I am so relieved that all of my horrible feelings last week and over the weekend were just me being hyper sensitive and lonely!  Maria - Im still not sleeping well either.  I woke up in the middle of the night with a searing pain in my right one - I think when I rolled over I pulled something.  UGH  How many more months?  LOL

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2011 03:14PM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria thats great your son is liking the healthier options!  Keep up the good work!  And dinner sounds great!!! We are having my tortilla soup but with turkey - and the usual spinach salad with egg, tomato and avocado....so lots of proteins, iron and vitamin C. My DH had to go through a little 'mourning' of my breast.  The whole thing really shook him.  He has been taking photos to document the process and that seems to really make him feel better.  He didnt get 'pregnancy photos' and that still bothers him.  So the night before my surgery, we took some photos and then got silly with some 'dessert toppings' which I let him take photos of that too.  It loosened him up so much...I think it was the best decision I made during this process.  It included him and made him feel like everything was going to be OK.  Maybe that was TMI - but It was so hard to read him before the surgery and I wanted him to know that I was aware that he was struggling with this too.

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 11:44AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey Ladies!!! With a new day brings a change in attitude!! Its gloomy and rainy here in Dayton, but I got to go to my first ZUMBA in 7 weeks!!! And to make it even better, my Best Friend came with me too!!! YIPPIE!!!!  My instructor was so happy to see us because to him, we just disappeared...but I told him not to worry and that it would have to happen again soon enough, but we love him and its all good.  LOL We went to the toning class which is less dancing/cardio and more form - crunches, squats, arm movements with weights....that sort of thing.  I did great except for anything where my arms had to be extended behind (like when you try to push shoulder blades together).  My movement is about 100% but I totally feel that last 10% if you know what I mean so I took it easy.  I also would put the right weight down 1/2 way through a song as not to overdo.  I SO want to go tomorrow for the zumba fitness class now!!!  But not sure if BFF can - I was shocked she came today but I know it was to keep an eye on me. She watched me the whole time and asked me if I was OK at every grimace!!! Gosh you gals, Im so proud of you with the chemo.  I can only imagine.  BC enough on the plate - the surgery, the worry but then the followup treatments.  Im so proud of you for staying the course and doing so well. Anniemomofthree - No, no Youtube video today!!! LOL!!!!  For a video for yourself, you can try the zumba website to see what they have and maybe get it cheaper at Amazon.  I wouldnt buy the whole set until you know you like it.  If you have a Wii, I would get the Wii Zumba game.  Its cheaper than the videos and there are levels - and you can do one song, or 20 minutes only or whatever.  I dont have any of the videos but I do have the game.  I just love my class!  All of the teachers are so different too! Barbara - GOOD FOR YOU!  On getting the freezer set up!  I did some chili and some tortilla soup as well as spaghetti sauces for the freezer.  Pot Roast works really well in the freezer too - just the meat though, not the veggies.  If you make a large roast for yourself one night, you can probably freeze two more meals worth.  Ill have to try the swiss steak! Oh and Barbara, thanks for the chemo info but I am the lucky gal here who doesnt need chemo.  I had DCIS and turned down tamoxifen too.  I had a single mx and am working on recon - so Ill be getting the house and myself back in order for another 6 week restriction but probably sometime in June.  My poor family and friends were like, again???  really?  Youre not done yet???  Nope, sorry!!!
