Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 07:06AM SuebeeBC wrote: Welcome Silia!  This is a fun thread...enjoy! I think everyone will agree that anything that strenthens your core and back will help the most post surgery.  You wont have your arms to get you out of bed or even use the toilet (I did a lot of leg strengthing too for that purpose).  Everyone here has their own brand of exercise so do what you love!  I do Zumba and biking myself - but some here are into hiking, elliptical, weights, aerobics....whatever.  Im glad I had my leg and core strength and my metabolism was kick started so after surgery I ate twice as much and didnt gain much of anything....it carried me through.

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 09:18AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Day all!!! I think I must be wonder woman or something because I keep waiting for the pain Im supposed to have from getting 75ccs....now I wish I got 100!!!  I took preventative tylenol before the fill and then before bedtime but there were hours and hours in there I didnt have any pain killer in my system and I also woke up fine.  I do have my arm pain today so took a little something for that. I was going to do zumba today but alas life got in the way - I had my hair done this morning and DH had the van with the kids - their appointments ran long so I ended up walking home...about 2 1/2 miles...not bad but it cut it too close to zumba so I bagged it.  Ill go Saturday.  Hmm, maybe Ill do a stationary bike at the gym tomorrow to make up for it. Maria - thanks for the stretching reminder.  I bet that would help my arm too.  Good Luck today with the treatments!  Sounds like you do well to be ready at home for your treatments.  As for my TE's - they are 350's but I am pretty sure that's the implant size he is going for so there will surely be overfill.  He is being conservative I think.  He will let me go bigger if I want, but he wont let me go too big for my frame.  Thats good because I may get boob greed and try to go too big....lol....now that I can CHOOSE instead of waiting to see what God gave me in my teens. Redsky - My TE's hurt a lot while my chest adjusted to them.  When I tried rolling over at night I would awaken with sharp pains.  Also reaching for stuff really hurt too.  It took about 6 weeks for me to adjust to that.  Did anyone talk to you about Tamoxifen?  Even with DCIS I had to meet with an Oncologist about taking that.  I refused it, but she said it is a standard course to offer it to DCIS patients. Rennasus - No worries on the incision at all.  He said it looks great.  Although he was surprised that 75ccs didnt bother me a bit.  Ill have to boast that it didnt even hurt later on as expected.  Good luck with your surgery monday.  I am sure it will be fine.  My TE still has a lot of give, especially around the incision. Annie - I was rather bad with desserts for a while.  Im back on track now but man the chocolate craving was the worst!  I had my friend in Europe send a HUGE box of sweets for me.  Well, I HAD to indulge in THAT!!! Melanie - Good for you on the walk/jog!  Its amazing how even something as easy as a walk can boost your mood, metabolism and strength!  Keep up the good work!  The only thing I was told not to do is run.  Darn.  Im being sarcastic!  My friend wants me to do a 1/2 marathon with her this fall and the only way she'll take NO from me is my doctor saying so....so now I have my 'doctors note' on that one!

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2011 04:15AM SuebeeBC wrote: Black Bean and Corn Salsa In a large bowl: 1 can black beans (I use low sodium) or prepare the equivalent of dry 1 can corn 1 red bell pepper chopped 1/2 red onion chopped In a small bowl for dressing: 1/2 cup chopped cilantro 3-4 Tbs EVOO - quality counts 3-4 Tbs Lime Juice 1 tsp cumin S&P to taste whisk and add to the veggies.  Serve with chips, over chicken or as part of a salad. Of course everything is to taste....I have used other color peppers, more oil and lime when I wanted more dressing, and I usually up the cumin and cilantro.  You should be able to get everything organic too.

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 07:19AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi Ladies Its a pretty icky Wednesday here in Ohio!  Ive already been out on an orthodontist appointment and did a light grocery shop and now I totally do NOT feel like going to Zumba!!!!  On Wednesday I take the kids to a sort of church fellowship afternoon and while they are there I go to Starbucks (I call it St. Arbucks to make me feel better about doing that while the kids are at church) and have a coffee and read for an hour and 1/2....so if I go to zumba it will be a run to the next activity.  Between that, feeling very tight from yesterdays zumba and wanting to replace wednesday zumba with something else, I think Ill just stay home and continue my son's cub scout scrapbook.  That was a long winded explanation as to why I am not exercising today!!! Maria we have a huge international market here and I can get a lot of products that are organic and natural without much trouble.  Now that I can read the labels too (after my crash course living overseas), I can pick out good products.  I dont buy my Japanese Rice or Italian Olive Oil anywhere else!  I can also get the European cheeses, butter, etc...even some exotic vegetables we got used to. Red sky- right after my last fill, my sore arm came back.  Im prettty sure that means the TE is sitting on a nerve.  Its OK again today but its been over a week.  I noticed today that the skin and TE softened a LOT which I appreciate, but i am still pinching when I put on a coat or reach above my head like the TE is sutured in.  Oooooow!!!   The TE gets better with time, but I dont notice if its exercise or not thats getting it there.  I just go about my normal routine.  My Zumba class over the past week (3 classes) were all equally hard on the TE side.  Sleeping and daily activity got better after a few days. My next fill is May 10 (another week delay!) and I am going to nail down a size and date if I can.  Im at 335 and intial thoughts were about a 350 impant but I may ask to fill to 400 (65 ccs more) and see how I like that.  I would be happy with a 350 but I think I want to shoot for a little more.

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 01:49PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi gals! Anniemom- Im trying but I am hardly a "Smartie"...I am doing a change at a time right now.....organic milk and cream, hormone free meat, and the 'dirty dozen' (if you havent heard of that, its the 12 most pesticide laden fruits and vegetable - the ones you should be buying Organic if you cant afford to get everything organic).  I swapped out my lipstick, shampoo, deoderant and face scrub.....but its a one product at a time thing.  Im getting SOOOOO overwhelmed by that book that I have to do things slowly or I get a little depressed. Currently my TE is twice as big as my natural girl so I have to wear a sports bra every day and 'fluff' my natural girl.  Its easy right now with the Danskin wirefree sports bra (foam cups) and I use an old padded bra cut up as the fluff. It works well now.  I WILL be having an implant put in that side when I decide what size to be.  They will just calculate what they think is the volume of that side currently and reduce the implant size by that....So if they think I have a volume of 200, my implant on Leftie will be 250 and on the right 450.  I dont know if I had mentioned that I was about a phone call away from setting a surgery date for Breast Augmentation when I learned of my DX - so I am continuing with Plan A once Plan B is complete!!!  I cant believe I am admitting all I do on the internet!!! Barbara - yeah Chemo 3 is done!!! you deserve some R&R and enjoy that!!! Looks like tomorrow may be a good day for a bikeride as long as its not too windy.  BFF wants to try a longer haul bikride soon so I need to get stronger.  She is also starting to train for the 1/2 marathon and wants me to join  her....but its the only thing I cant do (running with the TE) so I promised I would do it next year with her.  Its great having fit friends to keep me on my toes!!! Dinner is homemade chicken tenders (made with panko) and a stir fry of summer squash, mushroom, onion and zucchini.  Better get on that one!!!  Have a great evening!

Posts.Content: May 16, 2011 09:15AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey Gals - quick pop in.  Monday is my grocery shop/cooking day (Well SUNDAY and Monday are cooking days, really - but I was missing stuff yesterday) and then I run to the last Choir Rehearsal before my son's big show tomorrow night!!!  YIKES!  I'm making clam chowder for tomorrow night's dinner and I was going to make sauce for the fridge but looks like I dont have enough time.  I was too slow with the chowder! Maria - I hear ya about the weather - whats up with THAT???  I guess Im torn on whether I like it to be spring or summer yet.  Its easier to cammo my left one when Im wearing a hoodie than a tight T like I did Saturday.  I hit Trader Joes yesterday too....I didnt get much however. Redsky - I return to the recliner at times too.  Its rare.  Once I found the magic formula with positions and pillows, Ive been bedding it.  I still wake in the night however and get zingers when I change positions after being in one for a while.  MY PS doesnt want me to run but I do Zumba and Biking - I find that right after a fill, Zumba aggravates the pec muscle/TE area.  But I also find that my ARM isnt as sore when I exercise so its a catch 22.  Last week I had much better time with my fill because I didnt do Zumba but my arm is much sorer - so tomorrow I do zumba again.  I dont do aggressive shimmies or jumps either way.  My last fill *fingers crossed* is May 24, next Tuesday.  Im at 415 now...he hasnt told me what implant he is thinking about but we were discussing 450 in early days.  I opted for a 350 on my good side so I dont know what that will translate for the mx side.  I dont have much on the good side.  My skin is super tight too but maybe because I go every other week for fills I get to see the skin and muscle soften in between which is encouraging.  I tell PS that I swear its shrinking in between and he said no, that Im just getting used to it.

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 04:34PM SuebeeBC wrote: Redsky I agree.  I have a 350 TE and it will overexpand to nearly 500....I think that is a LOT.  Im overfilled by 65 right now but I have dramatic softening except of course for the port area.  So that makes me believe that the TE can handle the overfilling well.  Its overall still firm but I can press on all edges and get a nice 'give'.  Must be time for another fill!!! And I agree on the photos.....we took photos for DH and I NEVER intended to show them - but the forum helped me so much so I thought I would do it.  I still havent shown my TE to my best friend...my husband is FLOORED that I havent done it yet.  Its partly because I worry how she'll take seeing the scar, no nipple and basically the look of the whole thing.  But I want to show her so she will appreciate the final outcome.  I am so hung up on my naked body (at least I was pre BC) because my boobs were so small.  But Ive been through so much now that I feel like the TE is like a badge of HONOR and Im on my way to a couple of trophies! Barbara if youre serious about posting photos, maybe I can talk you through it.  Do you have a Mac or PC?  If you have a PC and right click on your photos, choose "resize" and select "small", they will be the right size for uploading.  Then when you start your thread, you can see at the bottom a place to browse for your small photos. OK, back on subject - Zumba was awesome today and I was SO glad I went....especially since I will miss Tuesday for a fill.  The teacher was so proud to tell me about the new Toning songs he has but I know I will probably miss quite a few of those coming up!!!  I do have to say that its TOTALLY getting noticable that my TE and Fluff do NOT match.  Im trying to fluff well, but when youre moving around as much as I am in Zumba, the TE side stays put while the fluffy side shifts, crumples and rises up.  UGH...it will only get worse before better.  I better switch to loose Ts for a couple of months!!! DS's baseball game was great too but I am SO sunburned....DANG IT I forgot sunscreen!!!  TOO much to think about!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2011 04:28AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Morning! Melanie - GREAT to see you!!!!  Sorry about your brother.  I have two GREAT brothers but my sisters leave something to be desired.  One is socially inept....she will call to ask how I am doing and before I can say much of anything will start telling me about her dog or her new TV or whatever.  The other one I call "The Hurricane" because she would blow in, wreak havoc and leave.  Ah alas, family dynamics!!!!  I am a little worried about going 'home' for MIL's service because it will be the first time anyone sees me since before diagnosis. Blah. Im glad youre still moving....you'll get more energy and stamina.  Youve been through a lot, girl!  You'll get there.  Im proud of you for plugging along and working it.  How did your appointment go?  Ah, another chapter in the novel of life. Maria - No I do NOT think youre being mean at ALL.  But I AM really glad that youre not giving it too much though.  You'll be much healthier for not dwelling on it.  As for vitamins, I was taking a multi vitamin and my protein shakes regularly (and motrin!) but Im within a week of surgery and will back off those until after.  Ok, in the category of converstations you thought you would NEVER have (yes another one of those nipple conversations I recently had).  I had a LONG chat with my BFF about boobs yesterday.  Last week when the neighborhood gals went out to lunch, my neighbor who had the augmentation was there.  BFF said to me afterwards that she thought neighbor shouldve gone bigger.  Me being all uptight still (cancer does that) decided yesterday to bring up that throw-away comment...I said "So....do you think I should go bigger?  I'd rather you tell ME than gossip about me later to someone else!" So we talked about boobs.  LOL.  She is a DD and warned me that bras in that size are really hard to find and small shirts (because we are petite otherwise) will pucker in front.  While she always was larger and loves her boob size (she just has ptosis now), its not easy clothing wise.  So there's the boob greed in check.  I think she will come to Zumba today so Ill get to show her my TE before exchange.  My DH is FLOORED that I havent shown her yet.  That will be another surreal experience...I dont normally go lifting my shirt to show my friends my boobs!!!!  Its getting close!  I cant wait for this thing to be gone!  Its SOO uncomfortable!  But I do have to say that its softening some!! PHEW!

Renn - yep I am totally worried about healing issues...but I stocked up on protein shakes and will start those immediately this time.  So I hope to do the high protein (eggs for breakfast, greek yogurts, my shakes and bars etc. to help with the healing!  Ill let you know how it goes! Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 05:11PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey Girlfriends!!!!  I'm alert so thought I would say hi and update!!!!  Renn - please update us with any news.  I thought I saw that you DID send a photo to PS? Barbara - SO glad you had a wonderful time in FL.  Fantastic.  Cleanse the mind! Melanie - How fantastic you made that connection with the woman at church.  I try to understand that people arent well versed in dealing with things like this and that is what creates the awkward moments and the constant 'how are ya's'  They want to connect but it comes out false.  One day in January - the weekend before my surgery - one of my friends called me to tell my about HER problem.  I was getting call after call with the 'how are ya' and I was SO tired of talking about it.  So this friend had a problem and thought to call ME with it.  I was never so happy to listen!!!  I think I told everyone that story.  I didnt realize how much it bothered me that no one was thinking that I would want to be a part of their lives like that.  Im going to remember that if any of my friends, God forbid, gets sick.  I'm praying you start to have more and more GOOD days!!!  Oh and I wanted to tell you how SMART you are for keeping those notes!!!  That will surely pay off!!! Shannon - ARMS UP!!!  Well, you can...I cant!  I can feel the upper poles of the breasts and I LOVE IT!!!  So soft and snuggly!!!    I can also squish on the bra a bit and tell how soft they are in there.  Im so darn happy!  And my arm doesnt hurt as much as even when I woke up this morning!  I could NOT sleep last night with this arm So here's a little more news from today.  The surgical bra is TIGHT!  I am having trouble breathing while sleeping on my back.  I keep feeling like a little asthma attack.  Nothing major and I have my inhaler right next to me.  The bra is giving great support and it helps with the up and down but its getting itchy!  Another small nusance I dont really mind.  PS says I can shower tomorrow if I want and was REALLY firm about lifting and exercising but I can go on the trip I will take in a few weeks.  I see him in 2 weeks and then in a month. My implants are 350 and 475!  I have my ID card and was able to look them up.  I hope the circumference difference isnt noticable....but he is the expert! The 475 surprised me but I guess that is what matched the best. So with my DH retired and not working yet I can count on him for more this time.  I think I told you I marinated some meats, made some sauce and basically planned out the menu for the next 3 weeks until our trip.  My son is still in baseball season so a lot of the meals are easy things like burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches and turkey kielbasa....so they can get off to the games 3 times a week.  I did NOT clean the house more than usual this past weekend and I did NOT do laundry.  I didnt want to knock myself out before surgery this time.  Let me know if you have questions about the exchange...I cant think off the top of my head what else you might like to know.  Lord knows Ill be sitting here for at least a few days!!!

Yippie!!! I woke up, took my meds with a Boost, and fell back asleep for 2 hours.  Then I woke up, had breakfast and went BACK to sleep - this time in BED for a little under 2 hours!  WOW  I was SLEEEEEPPPY!!!  The pain in the left is still quite evident but the right is improving quickly. That makes sense.  Im only sensitive on the right around the edges of the pocket.  I think the actual exchange part is fine - but any pocket work or fixes is what hurts...plus I still have no feeling across the front anyway.  My left nipple is totally saying "HELLO" though!  Its been sticking out so hard I can see it through the surgical bra and its sensitive (in a naughty, good way)  I hope that stays - a little payback for losing the other one. Maria - LOL no echo!!!  I havent tried flexing either because the bra is so tight I dont think I could.  It hurts to use the right pec to open the recliner.  My kids are like yours in the hating french fries and chicken nuggets.  My son refuses to eat school lunch and my daughter has always been anti-meat.  I have NO pre-made entrees ever in the house and my friends are amazed...but its only a little effort to make your own chicken tenders or lasagne!  Gosh I hope the job thing works itself out soon!!  The library hasnt called me back and im starting to worry I lost the job.  The orientation was supposed to be this coming monday.  :( Melanie - Glad you had a good day!!! Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2011 04:11AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good morning! Red - thanks for the update!  Yeah sorry you got sick but its past you!  You may feel really tired for some days.  I was surprised your surgery was 3 hours.  That could be why youre a little more tired too.  Someone told me that post surgery is a little like jet lag - it takes one day for every hour you were under to snap out of that feeling.  My surgery was about 1 and 1/2 hours but they had given me too much anesthesia so I had a ton of trouble coming out of it.  I was really glad that going into surgery my DPS told me that he would talk to my DH after surgery knowing that I wouldnt remember everything and he was so right!  Stay well, stay napping if you want...heal heal heal! Julie - 2 of 28 is a step forward!!!  Glad you have a cool tech and nurse.  That surely makes a difference....keep up the good work and youll be through to the other side soon! Marie - sorry this is so tough for you.  Youre not alone.  Many of us have had a lot of pain with our TEs or other treatments and certainly can understand.  Only you and your PS can make the right decision as to what is best for you.  Renn has had her TE taken out so knows about that.  There are threads out here somewhere that talk about going with NO recon, DELAYED recon or second or third tries with recon.  DIEP, TRAM, etc are other options for recon as well.   Perhaps the TE route isnt for you.  Perhaps (like with me) the TE is sitting on a nerve.  You have the weekend to formulate your questions for your PS.  Instead of saying 'I'm done I want it out" - think about how important reconstruction is for you (or not) and communicate this to him and ask if there are other options. There may be another route without scrapping the entire mission!  Good Luck! Well, I am really excited as I get to go to my library today!!!  I think I mentioned that my orientation covered all of my 'contracted hours' for the week but the librarian at my branch offered to me my regular hours in addition as a substitute.  I couldnt work Wednesday but instead picked up today.  So I get to meet everyone and work a few hours to get adjusted.  Im excited!  AND my DS is coming back from camp - I want my baby back!!!  He missed a lot this week as his team won the championship game on Thursday....I have his trophy.  I am REALLY happy this town doesnt do 'participatory trophies' - only for the top 2 teams.  YES.  Now the trophy MEANS something!  But thats a rant for another discussion board!  Have a great day!!!

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 06:38PM SuebeeBC wrote: Guys stay tuned on the nipple - I have no plans to postpone - Im ready enough. Dont know my restrictions - I picked the type of anesthesia I did (awake - but of course I worry about feeling it.) so I could have minimal recovery - I can technically go to work the next day...  Not sure about biking or Zumba.  She just doesnt want heavy lifting for a few days. Flap, no graft - yes.  There is a high rate of success with this type - minimal complications because its all local....I have read outside journals on this procedure and its praised for its high success rate and patient satisfaction.   It will be made 50% bigger than we want it to be so it can shrink to the same size as its girlfriend's.  (most of the descriptions I have heard about what it looks like coming out of surgery and for a couple months is it looks like nursing nipples- I remember those well - or for those coastal gals - little neck clams!!!) I will wear a guard over it to prevent failure or too much shrinkage - not sure how long....PS really stressed the importance of this guard...sounds like a sponge with a whole in it the way she described it....like a bunion pad. PS and I will map out the nipple together so we are in agreement on its placement. DPS said 'most of my scar will be used and id have a little scar left on either side when all is done' - looking at the size and thickness of my scar and location...I cannot comprehend how any of that can happen.  As far as I can tell, my nip will be placed ABOVE my scar line. and BS left me with one huge scar. Negative feeling coming from...a) the possible end to my biking season already.  b) the finale on any thoughts of revision although I am making peace with not having a revision - its kinda like how I felt when DH had a vasectomy...the conscious decision to be 'done'. c) another recovery! d) fear of the unknown - how it will look in clothes, will I fit in current bras, what if it warms up again?  Will I like it?  Will it help with symmetry?  Its not really the last step - Ill still need the tattoo in about 3 months....although for me that wont take much doing....I might be better off not getting one. Thats all for now.  I shouldnt have watched that video.

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 03:35PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey Maria - good luck with the appointment tomorrow!!!  I have these little bouts of feeling like all of these doctor appointments are really digging into my free time!  LOL - I know, I know, its all progress toward the goal....but its just a comedic coincidence that all of my appointments are Tuesday and that's my Zumba with my BFF day! ANYway - I was a slug today!  We had a church luncheon today so that took up a lot of today.  I read the paper and did laundry so that counts a little.  Now Im working on a kid friendly dinner - home made chicken tenders (with panko), whole grain long rice, cole slaw, and steamed veggies.  I have some organic berries for dessert too. I wanted to remind everyone about green tea!  Im struggling getting more than 1 cup of green tea a day in.  Today at the church luncheon I almost went for the coffee urn when I noticed green tea packets and switched.  I lived in Japan, but I DO know that green tea can be hard to take for newbies - but the antioxidents in green tea is crazy!   You can get the tea flavored (or with pomegranate or bluberries for an extra kick of good stuff.....and if you want something REALLY mild - try WHITE tea.  You can also get white tea flavored with fruit and get by without sugar at all.  I posted this article on some other threads about the benefits of green tea.....in case you needed that gentle nudge to give up the afternoon coffee and switch over.  Ill be the first to tell you that giving up the second and third cups of the day has been rough!!!! http://healthnewsreport.blogspot.com/2009/07/white-tea-vs-green-tea.html Tomorrow its due to get into the upper 60's!!!!  My DH and I have a date with our new bikes.  The plan is to go 10 miles to the next town over and have brunch (a 3 egg white omelet with spinach, tomato and onion for me with fruit!) and come back.  That will be the exercise for tomorrow!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 02:26PM SuebeeBC wrote: Redsky - I think your expansions are causing you more of the discomfort than the MX with the sleeping.  I had 100 put in at surgery and didnt get a fill for 8 weeks because of incision issues.  I had the two fills.  The first was fine, but this one, yes I got a zinger in the night when I rolled over.  I was sleeping in bed by 2 weeks after surgery...the first try was at a week and 1/2 and I could only be on my back....then I tried the left side....it was another week before I could figure out how to do the right.  But I got the zingers when I rolled over for probably 6 weeks.....then none until this wednesday with the fill. It was really hard to reach back and get my light off for so long!  I think it was about 8 weeks before I was really feeling like I could be normally active - fully stretching and lifting. Im 5'5 and about 118.  My band is a little smaller - 28.   The TE's are 350's which is the projecteed implant for a full B.  When I get to 350, I will try on implants on my natural side (in a sports bra) to see if I want to go bigger or not.  I want to be a small C as I think any bigger would be too much for my small frame.  I am REALLY hoping to be at 350 the first week of May (I go every other week).  Im starting to feel a little boob greed though now that I am getting used to the 255's!!!  My BFF is a DD and will yell at me as soon as I try to think about going any bigger than planned though.  My neighbor is going for a boob job too (she is about my size but a little thicker in the torso and is starting with natural boobs) and she wants to go for 475 implants...I told her that she is NUTS.  LOL   Anyway Red, there is a thread about "anyone staying smaller (B)' that is great fun and talks a lot about fills and exchange surgeries. I'm really glad you have someone bringing meals!!!!  I had 1 month of daily delivery which was great and tiresome at the same time.  I still needed delivery afterwards (again with the incisions) but, well, not everyone made things that the family liked.  I hate to sound ungrateful but it started getting harder when the kids wanted second meals prepared.  :( I was bad today - just dog walks...no gym.  It was a beautiful day though!  I hope it holds and we can bike tomorrow.  I was hoping to get to lunch with my BFF but she cant.  Boo.  Better for my legs maybe.  Have a great evening!!!

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2011 01:19PM SuebeeBC wrote: I have to check in with my new BFF's!!!  How are ya'll doin today??? Boy THAT was me being mid-western...we dont say Ya'll in MA!!! Melanie - so glad you got the pains under control and good for you to continue walking.  I dont really 'miss' running but Id like to give it a serious try.  Runners legs look so nice. Like dancers legs...long and lean. Maria - how did the fill go?  Wow 470!  Nearly double me right now.  How are you feeling about that?  I have this tight LS Tshirt DH bought for me and until today, Ive been breastless in it...one natural flat one and one missing....I havent worn it since fills...today I put it on and said to DH "how'dya like me NOW?"  LOL....even at a B I feel sexier. I concur about the soups....so easy to make and freeze 1/2.  Then youre meal ready for another night later.  Just dont try it with cream soups and dont reheat in plastic. Barbara  I am SOOOO glad youre feeling better!!! Thats GREAT!  And a roasted chicken is SUPER easy.  Preheat to 350.  I simply wash and pat dry the bird (make sure you take the pouch out of the inside of the bird that has giblets and stuff).  Some people put oil on the bird to give that skin a little crisp adn browning but I dont anymore.  I sprinkle on S&P, onion powder, rosemary, sometimes thyme or garlic.  Bake for about 20 minutes per pound or until the thermometer in the thigh is 160. THEN you can do the toasties!! I went to Zumba toning today - the instructor changed a couple of songs and it was a GREAT workout.  Im so pleased he changed stuff because it was getting a little easy and predictable.  I feel like I will be feeling this tomorrow!!  I love that. Nothing fancy for dinner....Tuesdays are my slacker days in the kitchen...its pasta night with my homemade veggie sauce and all natural garlic bread. And of course SPINACH!!! Nearly every day!

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 05:14AM SuebeeBC wrote: Ok, Im back already.  My morning plans were totally shot between the bike ride and realizing the thrift shop (where I was planning to sell some stuff) is open at NIGHT on Thursday and not the morning.  So here is that Marsala recipe! Rennasus - I try to use organic or natural where possible but this is hardly fat free! 2 Chicken Breasts skinned, bones, cut into strips.....OR 4 very thinly sliced chicken breasts if you can find them.  1/4c WW flour.  1/4 tsp basil.  1 cup (I use more like 2) cups sliced mushroom.  1/4 c sliced green onion.  2 tbs butter or EVOO.  1/4c chicken broth.  1/4 marsala cooking wine. If the chicken is thick, pound it thin.  Stir together flour, basil, and some S&P.  Press chicken into flour. Melt butter or heat OO in a large skillet.  Saute the mushrooms and onion until tender - set aside.  Heat more butter or OO and add the chicken until brown on both sides - about 4 minutes. Return mushrooms and onions to pan.  Carefully add marsala and broth....simmer ans stir until you notice it thickening.  Transfer to a plate and spoon sauce over all. Here's a tip with the green onion.  If you ever notice that you buy green onion, use a little and the rest goes to waste, try chopping it all up and freezing it in snack size baggies in 1/4 cup measurements.  Most recipes I use call for green onion in 1/4 or 1/2 measure.  I can go to the freezer and grab a bag or two and use it in any recipe.  I also ALWAYS go to make something and realize I dont have green onion in the house - and there it is waiting for me in the freezer!

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2011 09:07AM SuebeeBC wrote: Redsky - how funny how different our Military Hospitals are!  Are you from MD or stationed/retired there?  We are in OH but from New England.  We retired last month.  I am surprised you dont see your PS for fills...or unless you request!!  That seems crazy to me given how many questions I ask each time I am there.  What is your ribcage measurement?  I measure between a 29 and 30 so I could go with a 34 or 36 bra depending on the brand.  I have a 36B on now and fill it nicely....but I was only ever a baby B when nursing and an A the rest of the time.  My TE is 350 and I was going for a 350 implant but change my mind up....so I will be looking at more fills and a larger implant...maybe 400-420?  Ill have to ask him next time. Im getting anxious now that my fills are very close to the goal!!! I was cleared to exercise at 7 weeks but remember I had the incision issue.  I was told before surgery that I could workout (no lifting) at 4 weeks.  The only thing I am not allowed to do is run...but I understand that every PS is different on this too.  Those first few weeks back were ROUGH for me....I felt like I was starting over with Zumba and biking....so weak!  Now I feel back to normal but it took maybe 10 lessons...so about a month.

Posts.Content: May 22, 2011 03:40PM SuebeeBC wrote: Melanie - wah ha ha...that was awesome.  OK Ill stop now!    Did you get out to plant the flowers? Maria - I am with Melanie on trying not to stress SO much about it.  I strive for healthier choices and am hormone positive too.  I just work on the hormone free meats and dairy - the pesticide free veggies and reducing sugars right now....I dont drink soda at all and got rid of all fried foods but even THAT is impossible to completely erradicate.  I was working myself up so much before and losing weight too and I am sure part of it was stress.  I would DEFINITELY take my own food to MILs.  But I would do it in a pleasant way - we ALWAYS bring something when going to a BBQ so I used to just make sure it was something my kids would eat.  You can bring a side/main...you CAN find all beef, hormone and nitrate free franks in the stores too.  I really DISLIKE hotdogs and usually get imported deli franks (No hormone meat in Europe) or Angus beef. Or claim Vegetarian and bring veggie burgers?  Id say with BC, we have the forever trump card on stuff like this!!!  Tomorrow I hope toget to our local butcher to get some fantastic local meats (Hormone free, solution free, sausages made on site, all wrapped up in white paper - LOVE THAT). Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 11:34AM - edited May 24, 2011 11:35AM by SuebeeBC Hi everyone - awake from my nap and ready to fill you in!   I started my appointment practically begging but not quite coming to tears over this move of his coming up.  He told me that he waits 3 weeks from the last fill to do exchange - all well and good - until he told me that he has is orders already and they took away all of his O.R. time for June.  I was absolutely heartbroken.  He said - lets double check your symmetry with the implant and TE which we did and he said that we are almost there.  So I got 80ccs in (which I could really feel but was I going to ADMIT that???).....so I am at 495ccs.   Then he said I have to go back in one week, we are really cutting it close, but he MAY be able to work something out - BUT if I have complications from the surgery - I dont have a PS to go to until Mid July when the new one comes (a lady), I would have to go into Dayton for followups until then, and he wouldnt be able to do my nipple/areola.  But as an option, I could always fly to Texas to see him.  Ok, so all said and done (is this making sense?) my husband and I came away with completely different feelings on what he was trying to tell me (I think he speaks cryptically).  I thought he is bringing me back in a week to maybe top me off and tell me he cant do the surgery....DH came away thinking that Im going back to finalize everything and have my surgery the 3rd week of June.  Lots more was said at this appointment but this is the gist.  So I dont know what end is up STILL.  This fill is really hurting more than the others.  Rennasus - I know 80 sounds like a LOT but people really handle it differently and for me each fill was harder so 4 other fills at 80 were NOTHING for me.  Some people cant hack 30ccs....Id see how you feel going forward. So no Eday.  It could be the 3rd week of June or Ill end up having to wait for the new PS to arrive (July 1), in-process the base (2 weeks) and THEN see me...then there would be pre-op.  I will DIE if I have to wait until August.  I know there is nothing I can do about it but my whole summer is about being at the waterpark and pool and my boobs are SO different now that it looks like I had the MX on my natural side.  That was my rant/vent for the day. Redsky - Im glad youre done with fills!!!  Ill be getting a 350 and 450 Mentor HP.  Ill take pix of me today at 495 with and without clothes and get them online so we can compare!!! Rennasus - glad you made a decision youre at peace with.  Keep us up to date on how things go!!! I obviously didnt do Zumba today.  I dont think Ill be able to do much this week again.  I dont want to pull anything and add more pain to it.  Bad news too....my MIL has taken a dramatic turn for the worse.  She has a rare form of lukemia that they have been treating with meds and transfusions but at her advanced age they cannot do much for her.  She has gotten so bad in the past 2 weeks that they have decided to stop treating her and gave her 2 weeks.  We were going to leave tomorrow for NH but now believe that it will be too much for the kids to sit in a hospital for 5 days watching Grandma decline, so my DH will go alone.  We may all have to fly out there for a funeral if it happens while he is gone.   Anyway, sorry Im Debbie Downer today....rough day at the office!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2011 07:46AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good morning ladies!  Well, Im ready to get moving.  Crap that only took 2 days.  I am going to have to GLUE MY PANTS to this recliner for the next 12 days.  I slept through the night (well, I woke up at 4:30 to take meds but I blew them off and slept 2 more hours)...and after a lovely breakfast this morning I was able to take a shower.  It felt great and was super easy.  No trouble washing hair or getting dressed.  My boobs look great.  Im so happy already.  My right breast feels like its bruised especially on the side and upper pole....the left is much more miserable but its bearable. Melanie - Sorry about the scheduling issues...I hope its just an inexperienced receptionist.  If the doc wants to see you twice a week, the onus is on them to fit you in.  My PS receptionist would mumble that there was nothing open every flippin tuesday (this isnt a surprise, Im here every tuesday, lady!) but I would just stare her down....Doc wants to see me on TUESDAY!  LOL  And sorry youve been having a bad time right now.  We are here for you!  When is your birthday?  {{{big hug}}} from me for your day! Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2011 08:50AM SuebeeBC wrote: YES - AND STOP LOOKING!!!! You have a little frame like me....here's my response to that.  I DEFINITELY wanted more than what I got.  Right now they look small to me.  I was really liking the projection of the 550 TE.  Absolutely.  BUT - look at this site: http://www.mentorwwllc.com/pdf/Product_Ref_Guide.pdf And scroll down to the HP implants and look at my 350 and 475.  Notice the WIDTH of them.  With every little bit, the WIDTH increases but not necessarily with the projection (like 350 to 375 is increased width but not height).  13cm is a lot for one of my boobs...I couldnt imagine two of those in there.  Or for that matter - anything wider than what Ive got.  My cleavage is less than a pencil width at the sternum and I go all the way to the sides...granted I am SMUSHED right now, and I know they will drop and fluff so I am told,   Honestly would love them bigger but I dont think my chest could handle any more...width wise.  Does that make sense?  I dont think anyone explained that to me before. My DH wants to take the 'one week out' photos....maybe Ill post them

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2011 08:01AM SuebeeBC wrote: Red - I second the motion on being calm about the exchange.  I was worried the week up to it about if it was 'too soon' and every other issue....but really, I prepped for it, I researched, and I made peace with it.  I looked at the first surgery as 'getting the cancer out' and this one as 'the first step back to ME'...I felt totally different about them.  Now that I am two weeks past, I AM getting back to me.  I love looking at both of them and marveling at what science can do for us now.  Sleeping without the TE is SO much easier.  I dont even need extra pillows anymore.  I still wear a bra to bed but I am getting so used to it.  I know once they drop and fluff I will be confident in my appearance again.  I know you will be too!!!  Hang in there girlfriend...you can do it! Im glad youve been hiking too.  Sounds WONDERFUL right about now!!! Maria - you hang in there too.  BELIEVE me I know how you feel about the bordem....OH DO I UNDERSTAND!!!  But really, two week, or two months or whatever it takes to get better is a BLIP on the map of life.  When my husband was first hesitant about taking our assignment in Japan I said to him "3 years IS a long time....when youre in it...but I promise some day you will look back on those 3 years and think where did the time go?"  and we do.  It seems so far away now - like any period in our past...long while youre in it, a blip of life later on!!!!  So heal and take your time and you'll be better for it later!!!!  There thats my pep talk for today!!! I just took my shower and looked and felt and poked around at my girls.  They are not twins anymore but I love them each for what they are.  And they are a total facination to me right now!  The incisions look great, the position is great and the softness is incredible.  They just are different...but I am being patient since like children, they have a long way to go before we know what they will be!!!

I was/am absolutely foob obsessed....I told my friend when we sat down to dinner last week "I apologize but its all Ive been thinking about, talking about, and looking at for 8 months!"  She said its like any thing else youre in the thick of, and it was OK (her daughter is autistic and Ive spent many a phone call with her on that topic!)  But I too have looked and analyzed everyone else.  Youre right - my PS said most women shoot for a C.  But I also realized that I really had no concept of what that meant for me!!!  If I got a C I wouldve been bummed out.  As 'little' or 'proportionate' (however you want to see that) I look in my photos, Im sporting a D cup!  I would LOVE to be bigger - but I know that would mean a REALLY hard time finding bras (I cant shop in stores already), my shirts puckering in front, and even possible implant complications (the pocket not handling the weight).  I WORK SO HARD at keeping perspective!!!  Its my new job! Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2011 05:07AM SuebeeBC wrote: Good Morning! Barbara I have to dig out my list that I brought in....but yes on the projection, expectations and fears.  Mine was about being "Level" (go figure) because I was a uni and with the upper fullness because Im thin.  I had a little different experience as I got to pick my size based on trying implants on the left side - but you'll want to know that he willl bring in various sizes to match.  You may even get two different implant sizes based on how they lay in the pocket!  Are you getting Mentors or Allergans?  Mentor's product catalog is online and you can look to see how as the ccs go up, the width grows but not in proportion with projection - so I will NOT get much projection out of going up a little amount.  Even at a 475 on the right and 350 on the left, my 475 is missing the nipple projectin and natural tissue over there so its seemingly getting flatter all of the time. Ask also about pain management, drains, what you need to wear afterwards (you see Maria and I were vastly different there), if you'll get getting constipation meds or will need to get some.  Will you need a bra right away?  Does he suggest sleeping upright and for how long? What are the restrictions for the first two weeks (before your post op visit)?  When is your post op?  Can you stretch at all? Is light walking ok?  Should you take any suppliments....protein shakes, vitamins, etc? to aid healing.  When should you expect to be able to drive?  Shower? A lot of this stuff you'll want to know before hand because at least for me, I struggled coming out of anesthesia so I remember little from the time I saw PS after surgery - he spoke mostly to my DH. Ill look at my list to see if I had anything else to add.  But the most important thing is setting your expectations with him.  Thats where women get disappointed.  They expect to look like thier TE or at least as projected and its not gonna happen.  Or they want them closer or further apart or higher or lower or bigger or smaller etc.  Mine change all of the time so I bite my lip when I think to worry about them.  Im level - thats what I wanted.  I also got the implant size I wanted.  Now I need to stop thinking about drop and fluff and stop looking at bras in the store until I can have my proper fitting.

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 02:32PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi! Julie - yes the answer is to 'step away from threads that dont concerneth thou!!!'  I got too wrapped up in other peoples issues that way and got really sad a lot of days....too overwhelming.  I was then on two threads only - then graduated to the exchange thread - then the bras thread....etc....no more diagnosis threads or surgery threads etc. Red - YEAH!!!  Its so close!  As for the bra - I had the surgical one for a week and THEN went shopping on the way home from the appt where he said to ditch it - and bought the LOF bras.  The trick for me now with sports bras with molded cups is, they are either too big in the band or too small in the cups.  DOH!!!  You could try a zip front or snap front bra (fruit of the loom has one snap front style at walmart) for support - no cups involved.  I wear mine to bed every night.  I found that anything that fit the TEs did NOT fit after exchange.  NADA!!!  So if you HAVE to have something before Thursday - get something without cups...and that doesnt go over the head.  Youll never get it on!  As for shirts to wear after exchange.  I did something clever (I think).  I wore my husband's Tshirt and some yoga pants to surgery and home.  They are so big on me that I could easily get them over my head and arms through.  After 2 days I was in my OWN largish tshirts - and pretty soon after that I was even in smaller shirts.  My ROM was back pretty quickly! Barbara - thanks about the job and ick on your weather.  We are in the mid-to upper 90s through another week with heat indexes well over 100 and thats BAD for here.  No biking for me.  :-(((( Melanie - OMG what a day you had!!!!  But Im glad youre down to 12 treatments! I love the countdown!!! Ok, enough catching up....Im still on dinner detail around here!!!!  DH did the beds, the laundry, the dishes, bought new things for the house (which I really dont like when he buys furniture on his own but ok) and entertained DD all afternoon so I cant complain.  He also got a Kurig so I can have my own fresh brewed iced coffee or tea or whatever else I want at any time.  Again its something I was sure I didnt want that I now love.

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 10:54AM SuebeeBC wrote: I was seeping in several places but pinholes...at about 2 weeks post op.  Then at 3 weeks I stupidly tried to do a little Wii Zumba and popped a hole a little smaller than a eraser head.  3 weeks later now and I have been going back to the doc every week to hear "we have to wait another week before filling".  I have been on two rounds of antibiotics (precautionary).  I have bactroban (he likes it better than neosporin).  I have to keep it moist with the cream (4 times daily) with a bandaid over it.  I have had to up my protein - I get 100g's now, a multivitamin 'wouldnt hurt', and not do anything vigorous with my arms/upper torso.  I cant bike for example, but I can walk.  No going to the gym. Today the hole is closed but there is pinhole spot that is still red and I get seepage on the bandaid in the mornings when I wake up....like just a frustratingly little dot.  Its definitely not looking all sealed over, but its so close. I would put a call in before you put anything on it but gauze or a bandaid now.  Keep it clean!  The PS said "game over" if one little germ gets in there and on the TE.  Ouch that was scary to hear!

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 01:41PM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria - Im sorry....vent away GF!!!  I was told 350 will make me a full B so with you being about the same size, Im hoping you'll be satisfied with the 375's.  I was hoping for a full B/small C but who knows....PS keeps reminding me that 'we'll see'.  We'll see about the time frame, we'll see about the fills, we'll see about the exchange date, we'll see how fast things heal up.  Sigh. Rennasus - I had similar yellowish/green stuff that I was able to blot right out of the incision.  At one point I had whiteish stuff filling the hole that I believe was plaque.  PS plucked it out and told me to keep the creme going but not to fill the hole with cream - just keep it moist - so that stuff wouldnt form.  I just would blot my incision daily with gauze and water to get buildup out of there and then do the cream.  Mine was never as large as you say yours has gotten - but at the point where I had 3 holes the BS did say to me that if the incisions didnt look better soon that they would have to take the TE out!  So I understand that shock and worry!!! I became a pest to my PS at the point where you are now.  I asked about taking vitamins, how much protein (not just "more"), is it due to lack of exercise (oxygen flow), how much I could move and WHAT I can be doing (walking, stationary bike), should I stop stretching for a time, any other foods I should eat or avoid (caffeine?), sleep positions, showering (should water hit it directly), blotting the wound...etc.  This is about the time my husband said to the PS "she is really freaking out about this...is the TE failing or is she just slow?  She needs some reassurance here".  Bless him.  I would suggest you be a little pest too.  This is YOUR body and YOU have to carry around the anguish of the incision and possible things going on all week long....he goes back to his day once you leave the room.  Personally Id rather know whats happening than make up stuff in my head. A BIG "HANG IN THERE" to you!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2011 06:36AM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria - Here are my thoughts.  Do NOT drive on Friday - even if your son has to miss school.  Everyone is different but I think you could drive on Monday if you have a very restful weekend and are doing well.  Is there no one you can call for a ride for your son?  Even for a day or two?  Its OK that they havent offered....no one offered anything for me this time!  I got "let me know if you need anything" and I said to two different people "well on tueday my family is all heading to an event so no one will be here to help me with dinner" and both went "hmmm".  I guess I shouldve been more specific.  That was the day after my surgery and I couldnt have moved.  Blah. I was a passenger in a car 4 days out just a couple of miles and back.  I felt OK but was a little woosy later in the day.  Just be careful.  I know youd rather have your son at school but in the grand scheme of things, you're a little more important right now.  He isnt missing final exams or anything.  And I would be ready with easy lunches for him too so youre not killing yourself all day either. I have been lucky that my DH is retired and both kids were in camp last week. Ive been taking FULL advantage!!! As for the food - well, I AM eating 2 meals a day in a recliner!!  I never thought I was messy before because crumbs dont stick to your shirt.  Only when I wear WHITE do I get spaghetti sauce all over me!  LOL.  And if I knocked and heard a reply, I would think that the surgeon left the boob fairy inside when he stitched me up!  That would be bad for everyone else!

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2011 02:31PM SuebeeBC wrote: Barbara - for me (and those of us overexpanded), the shock of seeing how 'small' we are after exchange is evident.  DO talk to your PS about your expectations.  I decided on my size based on my 'natural side' plus implant.  I got that, I feel.  It sticks out, but its technically a D and I asked for a C.....it just LOOKS small because of the fool TE I had!  "Drop" is when the implant settles into the pocket. It wont be so high and 'out there'  My right has started to soften like its getting ready to think about dropping.  "Fluff" is when it stops looking like a hamburger bun.  Its when the muscle relaxes so the implant looks more like a natural breast with projection.  My left is pretty unchanged to me - the right's swelling has gone down and it feels WONDERFUL! My PS said that since I had two different procedures, to expect drop and fluff (although he just said drop) to happen at different rates and this was normal.  The MX side may be hesitant or faster and thats OK.  He said when all is setlled, they should be the same.  YEAH!  I can clearly see that the pockets are even heights now so in 3-6 months I should have two beauties! Yeah I had one sister with the legs and one with the boobs - I got neither.  Now they will be jealous!  LOL! Maria - glad you pooped!  LOL.  And dont worry about them looking small.  Theyve been through a lot and were bandaged up quite tightly!!!!  I still think mine are small but I know they arent.  I tried on my new bathing suit last night because I am on vacation in a week....HELLO!  I totally look like a boob job in this suit because I am just OUT THERE.  I totally fill out the top  - almost too much.  So I am thinking I am bigger than I thought I was.  In regular clothes though, like Tshirts, I still think they are small.  LOL.  My husband makes the funniest face when I say they look small to me.  He thinks I am nuts too. I also learned from others that my size shouldnt CHANGE in the drop and fluff- just the appearance of things.  THATS good news. Gotta go get my daughter - ill check back later!

Well, I changed bras about 5 times today.  I tried on my new Chantelle like a crazy woman today.  Then I went back and forth with the rest of the bras.  I just couldnt get comfortable today.  My left must be fluffing or dropping or SOMEthing.  I put my Chantelle on about 20 minutes ago because my left one was screaming at me in the 34C I had on.  And its SO sensitive!  My right side has no nipple projection of course so it looks a little silly not filling the very front of the cup but the left is a super cute sex kitten in this bra...LOL You all just wait...you'll be giddy about bras soon too!!! LOL

Anyway, my intentions are GREAT!  I went to a bike shop today to reseach road bikes.  My BFF is an avid biker - she got me biking a few times last fall and I got her into Zumba.  So as soon as I am able we will be probably doing 20-30 miles once a week together.  I think it will be a whole lot easier on a road bike than my mountain bike!  I cant wait to get back to my 3X a week Zumba class too.  Oh gosh, I DO need to get a job at some point too.  Maybe in the fall (hee hee). As for meals - Im still not cooking, but every night I make a mixed salad primarily of spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms and eggs (protein) and whatever else I have.  We are working through my spaghetti sauces, chili's and soups I made before hand that are in the freezer.  Meals arent perfect yet, but I have to eat twice as much protein so that is the focus until I can go back to being a little heavier on the veggies.

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2011 04:07PM SuebeeBC wrote: Annie - I hated aerobics!!!!  You can do a couple of things.  Zumba Toning is much easier dance-step-wise.  They use 1 or 2 pound weights and work all muscle groups but the actually jumping/dancing thing is much easier.  You could try that first.  Or, and I hate to suggest it, is to find a zumba gold class...those are geared towards 'older' people or those who need a slower pace (recovering from surgery for example?).  I take class from a GUY!  This was great for me because I didnt feel the pressure of standing in front of a 20-something, skinny chick who grew up dancing and having to wiggle like her.  NOW that I have been doing it for months (it took me about 4 classes before I didnt feel like I was having a heart attack) I start to follow some of the other women in the class who squat lower and wiggle their hips more.  Feels great!!!

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2011 07:55AM SuebeeBC wrote: Maria - sorry about the system issues - I have the opposite problem these days- Im pushing so much protein that I feel so full all of the time!!  But the good news is I have no more HOLE!!!  Its nearly flesh with the rest of the incision even though its still weeping just a touch.  Ive been pushing 80-100g of protein every day so I will keep that up and not be so concerned with my tight fitting jeans just yet.  I have plenty of time to get sexy back!  LOL!!! Annielynn - good for you! Im jealous you all can work out more....hopefully I get to start back this week! Off topic - Im so glad the BFF chatter has helped others.  I spoke to another friend of mine who grew up a gymnast today and told her how I was feeling, and she reinforced how crazy meet season is and to hang in there with my BFF and let her do what she's gotta do right now. Gymnastics is such an intense sport and hopefully its just bad timing that is leaving me feeling so insecure.  I am confident that once my incision closes for good, I get that first fill, and the go-ahead to start exercising again, those happy hormones will start swirling inside again and Ill feel more like myself!!! Have a great day everyone!

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 07:40AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi all! Anniemom - WONDERFUL about the haircut!  Good for you girl!  You sound so upbeat and incharge!  Thats great! Rennasus - Gosh I am so sorry about the incision.  UGH!  I feel your pain.  I am SOOO pulling for that to heal for you!!!  You know it!  And vent away - its why we are here.  I was offered TX but I was so worried about it and my incision at the time.  I said "can I just HEAL first??"  The good news about TX is you can stop if the SE's get too bad for you - listen to your body!  There are a lot of good threads out there. Maria - Stay focused GF - you can do it!  As you said youre 1/2 way there on the chemo and you can get through the rest.  Its a bump in the road - you will see the other side soon!!!  It just doesnt feel that way some days!  The weather doesnt help, huh?  We are so cold here today Ick! Redsky - my first fill didnt hurt AT ALL - so I went about my normal day the next day.  We'll have to see how I do next time.  You'll probably beat me to the finish line at the rate Im getting fills though - every other week!  I calculated that if I get 50ccs every other week, Ill be at 425 by May 31.  Doc is expecting a 450 expansion and a 350 implant.  Hmmmm.....Can we try 75cc's each time?  I cant wait until JULY to wear cute summer clothes!!! My exercise today is housework - UGH!!!  DH invited friends over for tomorrow night which you KNOW what that means for the spouse!  I already bought snacks this morning and now need to get on laundry and cleaning the house.  I think I will do just one level again and say "they are YOUR friends coming - I did the kitchen and living room, you can do the game room and bathroom!!!"  It will be a workout JUST to motivate him right now I think!!!  LOL

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2011 07:46AM SuebeeBC wrote: I have to agree...if I had one injection, I wouldve been laughing with delight too.  It was less than a bee sting.  But I had 4, no numbing cream and they got increasingly worse.  Like some others, the most excruciating pain Ive ever felt - including childbirth.  Thank GOD it was only for about 5 seconds but I never want to feel that kind of pain again and wouldnt wish it on anyone.  And I can really take pain! But Im glad for those of you who were pleasantly surprised.  Thats fantastic.  I am sure the numbing cream and the number of injections changes everything.
Posts.Title: Radioactive Injection into Nipple NOT TERRIBLE waynesgirl50 Motherofall6

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2011 08:58AM SuebeeBC wrote: Fearless why do you think you made a mistake?  With the recon? I think 4 days out I felt a lot of pain still.  The TE's go under the muscle and that is a lot for your body to take.  Moving was difficult from the waist up for me and I had a single.  I was sleeping on the recliner for at least a week....then when I moved to a bed I had to deal with new pains all night long.  Searing pains every time I moved....and I agree about hating pain meds...I took them at night only after about 5 days. You also had a lot of fill....I got 100 at surgery and to date I am at 255....and I, after 4 days since fill, am still adjusting to the pressure on my pec muscle. I think for me, and everyone is different, that it was a week before I stopped feeling a lot of pain, but there were the jolts and discomfort from the TEs for weeks until I could start using my arms normally for driving, cooking, light cleaning etc.  I was shocked how long it was before I could drive without zingers.  It will get better.
Posts.Title: Much pain 4 days post-surgery - is that normal? Fearless_One Fearless_One

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2011 10:21PM SuebeeBC wrote: Totally normal and I agree about letting things out bit by bit.  Over the past two months I have been keeping it from my BFF because I knew she was overloaded with her work and I was busy being her cheerleader through it.  I totally forgot that I needed to let her into my life too.  I spent a lot of time over the last month overwhelmed, sad and frustrated by this....I finally had a talk with her last night and she totally supported me....but I spilled over like a firehose on her. Vent here, vent to a support group or therapist because they know best how to deal with it, but vent to your best friend and significant other so it doent build up.
Posts.Title: Fear, anxiety, pain... immediately post-surgery-what is normal? Winterpeg Winterpeg

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2011 08:17AM SuebeeBC wrote: Hey ladies glad I found this thread. I had my SMX in January and since then found a dull ache down my arm.  Its relieved when I move (i.e. exercise, cook etc) but its definitely noticable when I am sitting still and on the computer.  I do not wake up with it and dont feel it at all when lying down.  Like Nikola its hard to explain to the doc.  Its in my upper arm mostly almost like a pressure point....but when it gets worse it radiates up and down almost feeling like its ready to go numb but not quite the pins and needles. When I ask my PS or BS I get different responses.  BS says "hmmm...thats not a symptom of anything but if you want PT Ill write a script".  PS says "thats nerve damage and it will get better...take some motrin". Like some of you Id rather treat the problem rather than the symptoms...Im taking enough meds already!!!  I never heard of PMPS so I was SO glad to come across this thread.  Not a club I want to be in, but its good to know I am not alone.  How is everyone doing?  How long did you pain last (based on severity - I consider this a minor-moderate nusance right now)?  Does it get WORSE? Thanks

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 05:52PM SuebeeBC wrote: Stop the presses!  My date has changed!!!  :( My PS broke his arm!  UGH - Surgeons nurse calls today and says "you can still have the mastectomy on the 19th, wait until that heals and THEN put the TE's in.....OR you can delay a week until the 26th and meet a new PS this week."  YIKES! A little background, we are military and  get 'assigned' our docs so I didnt pick the first ones, but this is unsettling!  Oncologist wants to proceed, but I decided to postpone a week to avoid ANOTHER surgery.  I meet the new PS tomorrow.  As long as I feel comfortable with the new PS, I cant see a reason to have a third surgery.  Emotionally, I think looking down and not seeing the reconstruction progressing after the MX would take its toll too.  I have prepared myself for what was supposed to happen.  New PS feels I am making the right choice.  I think so too. Actually on the bright side, this is yet another opinion too so the new PS could very well confirm all of the other information I have been given...or open up new options.  I look forward to meeting with him tomorrow! But WOW - talk about a wrench in the works.  I know its only another week wait but I was mentally ready to go!!!  Sue

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 03:16PM SuebeeBC wrote: I did today (poop) and it felt great!  LOL  I AM a day ahead of you though so maybe it will come tomorrow?  I hope for you!  Sounds like you are uncomfortable! Are you all bandaged or not?  I have that glue-like suture so my dressings are off and have been since day 2.  A little teenie bit of the dressing under my arm is stuck to the suture and I was really afraid to tug so I hope it will be taken off tuesday....I just had DH cut as close as he could when we took the dressing off.   SO Ive already been through looking at the wound and dealing with the emotions of that a little bit.  I wonder if the whole thing wouldve looked differently if I didnt start with recon already?  I'm 4 days out and feeling pretty woosy!  Im able to shower and even washed my hair yesterday but didnt blowdry (i have a lot of hair and hardly have the stamina to blow dry it normally!!! Posts.Content: Feb 3, 2011 03:16PM SuebeeBC wrote: I had a single mx with TE placement.  I was able to get around (save for all of the hookups) right away and was discharged the next morning.  My core and leg muscles did all of the work for the first couple of days (I am a righty and that was the side done so I was a little afraid to move it).  But I was extremely tired for several days.  I didnt move about the house more than to use the bathroom and get water for a couple of days and didnt feel like going out of the house for 6 (they say that you will be out of it one day for every hour you were under). My BFF visited me a couple of days at lunchtime when DH went to work - one day I made my own lunch (maybe 5 days out?) and wish I hadnt.  I was pooped afterwards. It was a world of difference once that 7th day hit.  I feel like a different person. You could be fine if your DH went back to work....but it was so nice to have mine home for 1 work day and the weekend....at least have a friend pop by to make sure lunch is made I would say.  I didnt want to see anyone but my best friend and made that clear that I didnt want visitors either.  Even a few minutes when someone brings in a meal was tiring at first.  BY THE WAY - to everyone else - I got my drain out today!!! YIPPIE!  I called surgery and they had a cancel (I was supposed to get in Tuesday but the hospital was closed 2.25 days with the ice storm).  My DH ran me right in and everything looks GREAT!  I am so happy!  Next hurdle comes MOnday with pathology!!!  Sue
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2011 07:31AM SuebeeBC wrote: DMHO I agree and hate it when you feel like youre imposing on your docs for asking reasonable questions!!!  My drain came out thursday since I was getting less than 5 ever 12 hours...more like drops.  My site was really warm for a couple of days following too - not bad this morning. Min- this might be one for the doc next time you see him/her.  I have no bra, no dressings, nothing on me since i was discharged!  They used dermabond for sutures so I dont need anything covering it up. I wore one of my old bras yesterday since i had to go to a party and was so happy that nothing rubbed or bothered me...I can get away with my old ones stuffed cleverly on one side until I have my final exchange I guess.

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 03:18PM SuebeeBC wrote: JUST home ladies! Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 08:19AM SuebeeBC wrote: Cmblastic - my arm gets a funny feeling after I do 'too much'.  From my armpit to elbow it gets a dull feeling like its starting to fall asleep but not quite yet.  I sit down, elevate it slightly and in a couple hours it subsides....its the weirdest thing.  But it comes after I shower, get ready for the day, do my exercises and stuff like that...nothing heavy, just normal movements. Im going to mention it on Monday at my appt. Its not a pain- its just a weird feeling like its tellingme to stop. On other topics - How is the sleeping going?  I slept in bed on thursday and it was a disaster for me.  I had a smx and tried to sleep on the other side but every time my DH moved, I woke up sharply.  I tried again last night giving myself a second position - a 75% on the back (with a pillow wedged under my right shoulder) and made it through the night - waking up briefly a couple of times but thats normal for me.  Not terrible pain this time. What about sex?  DH has been acting a little more touchy over the past couple of days and Id love to get back to it, but Im really worried (and I know he is too) about jostling my right side.  Because of the dermabond, I dont have to wear bandages or anything and my TE's make things very tender.  The TE is far worse than the scar sites! Anyone getting back to other exercise too?  Since Thursday, its been like an awakening for me.  I really want to get out for a walk (if this weather would ever go away!!!).  I know I have to be really careful not to do too much. I am starting to feel better and thats going to lure me into doing something I shouldnt!!! Glad to hear so many of you are doing so well!!! Sue

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2011 05:39PM SuebeeBC wrote: Hi Terri and everyone! This is my first post anywhere so Im here to say HI and to add my name to the January list! Im having a single skin sparing mastectomy with sentinal node biopsy and expander placed on January 19th.  I am also going back to have breast augmentation on the other side once the right side is all filled up!  I have been found to have high grade DCIS, but because of my very small frame and breast size, a lumpectomy and radiation wouldnt have been a good option.  All BRCA tests were normal!  I have found peace with having the procedure done....ironically, I was in the process of having consults for breast augmentation when I had the mammogram that showed the calcifications. My main concern is the recovery!  As a woman, its hard to let go and let other people do everything...and this being my right side, Im worried how it will affect my day to day life and how long!  Of course I also worry about  my best friend taking on too much...she will and wont take no for an answer!!!  My huband will take care of the kids and house and I am sure I will have lots of meals delivered!  But with the tissue expander and how long that will take...then the recovery from the other side's implants...Im a little freaked about how long it will be before I feel like getting out to hang with my friends or go to my Zumba class etc! That was more of a vent than anything....Ive done a lot of research and a lot of chatting about it.  I just wish it was last month and not in 2 weeks that I am getting this done! I want it overwith!!! Sue

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2011 02:16PM SuebeeBC wrote: I go Wednesday!  Good Luck to everyone that goes this week! We have a snowy day here so I am cooking, cleaning and sleeping (cant do it at night!!!).  I have daily meals arranged for 3 weeks and all kid rides arranged as well.  DH is taking this week off for me and my BFF will be with me every day next week (she works in the evening) I am worried about the SNB too....please please be ok!!! I realized something last night that I wonder if you all feel.  I, luckily, feel like I have a legion of people wanting to help, show concern, etc which is a blessing....but I am getting really tired of fielding questions, seeing peoples looks and generally talking about the surgery and recovery!  The same people are asking the same questions again and again!!! Anyway, Last night a friend called and told me about what was going on in her life and I said "Oh THANK YOU for being a REAL friend...youre wanting to talk to me about YOUR day and not MINE!!!!"  It seems like everyone is forgetting to treat my like I am THEIR friend too and they are busy trying to show me that they are MINE.  Does that make sense?  I called my BFF right after that conversation and told her how much I love her for joking with me, telling me about her kids, and venting about her job.  Now I know I made the right decision about who is going to take care of ME (instead of a meal, ride, prayers, etc).  Anyway, blessings all around....I know I am brave and will get through it....just like in Finding Nemo..."just keep swimming, swimming, swimming....just keep swimming!" Sue

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 10:53AM SuebeeBC wrote: Barbara I tried sleeping in the bed after the drain came out (I had a smx with TE)...about 9 days out.  The first night, I slept only on the left side and it was rough....I folded a pillow in half to keep in front of me to rest my arm on it. But  I felt like I couldnt move.  The second night I worked out how to roll from left side to back and adjust the pillow so to support me. Finally, I figured out how to wedge the pillow under my right side so there is no pressure on the TE.  It took probably 5 days for me to work it all out, but it's absolutely doable.

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2011 09:10PM SuebeeBC wrote: Redsky - I was delayed twice but not quite as long.  I was Diagnosed in early November and was supposed to go in Early December and then once a week out of my Jan 19th date, my PS broke his arm and I was reassigned a new PS and had the additional week delay.  So I understand the frustration. I understand DCIS gives you time.  I was high grade-3 and was assured that the 7 week delay wouldnt really effect anything in the long run.  In effect, I got "the cells look agressive so Id like to get you in within 2 weeks".....and then "nope, we are waiting until Mid January"...huh?  I couldve gone on the 19th of January anyway but waited to meet the new PS and be able to start recon instead of adding a third surgery and additional delay. I would raise my concerns to your team.  They may be able to calm your fears.  I hate how DCIS gives you that hurry-hurry-nah, you can wait kind of feeling.  There is a DCIS forum here too where you can find more information. Seeking treatment elsewhere may not get you in any faster than the 28th too....just a thought.... Its a tough one!  Good Luck and let us know how it goes!!! Sue

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 05:15AM SuebeeBC wrote: I just had my hair done yesterday and my stylist asked me if I noticed any changes in my hair with surgery.  I said 'no - I never heard of that' and she said that its common for women to experience changes because of the surgery.....hair loss, thinning, breaking....because of the anesthesia effects. Maybe talk to your stylist to see if there is a temporary solution for you while you get through this - or at the very least, getting your hair done makes you feel GREAT!  :) Sue
Posts.Title: 3-months post-surgery and... my hair is breaking. Anyone else? sunshinegal NJMarilyn

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 10:32AM SuebeeBC wrote: Its nice to hear that everyone is doing well!!!  What a journey!!! Im 3 days out now.  I came home thursday morning and am facinated with the changes.  Im feeling less pain but more overall grogginess.  I slept through the night last night and completely missed my midnight vicodin.  I am astonished with my range of motion and hope that keeps up.  I have that darn path report on the brain though and cant wait for that already.  The RN told me (she wasnt supposed to) that I had 5 nodes removed and that worried me immediately....Like what was wrong that my doc had to take 5?  I thought she was taking 1-3???  So I worry. I also get the feeling my surgeon and ps dont like each other.  My initial ps broke his arm so I had to change PS's and this new one does things differently.  For example the first PS wouldnt have put the TE in if there was a problem with the nodes, but this PS didnt make mention that he was waiting for the nodes.  Surgeon rolled her eyes. Surgeon didnt like the markings that PS made on me before the surgery at all and kinda laughed.   I didnt even see surgeon after I was out...I did see PS the next morning.  He is taking the drains on Tuesday but surgeon was thinking 2 weeks.  I just think surgeon is far more conservative than PS.  Its so bizarre that the female surgeon is far less sensitive about the end result (being a woman) and more concerned about getting the DCIS out than the PS who is a man and very concerned about the look of things to come.  A little vent there.  Anyway, best wishes for continued healing for everyone....and blessings to those still to go this coming week! Sue
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 08:46AM SuebeeBC wrote: Min I second the motion about putting some exercise in the bank before you go in for surgery!  I do Zumba and was delighted when I could get out of bed and squat to the toilet without assistance (sorry a little graphic).  The way the toilet faced, the support bars were on the MX side so I couldnt use my right arm to help myself.....thus the leg muscles had to do it all.  I can imagine life would be THAT MUCH harder if my left side was done as well. No one told me to strengthen my core and legs before hand, but my PS, when I asked how soon I could Zumba again, told me that it was great that I was doing it and it would help my recovery so much if my muscles were strong before going in, It wouldve been nice if they told me that around time of DX!!!  Maybe its so people who dont exercise much dont go and overdo before surgery! Sue

Im supposed to go see the plastic surgeon tomorrow (I see the primary surgeon on the 7th) who will hopefully take the drain out....its down to a dribble - not even measurable.  Unfortunately we are due for a huge ice storm tonight through wednesday and my BFF wont drive in that (understandably) and I bet the kids will be home from school so I will have to reschedule.  DARN! So when did your endurance become longer than getting a drink or going to the restroom?  Im trying not to push it but dang!!  LOL! Sue

As for the driving, coincidentally I started driving the day before I started oozing.  I had my right side go through surgery so I am totally struggling with reaching to do things, or opening the car door etc on the right and forgetting that I shouldnt be using it.  If I had my left side done, I think I would be far better off but I am so right dominant. Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 02:45PM SuebeeBC wrote: OK - just in from the BS/PS - since I got to see them both!  A recap - I was having spotting on my shirt yesterday 3 times but nothing too bad.  I called today and got an afternoon appt.  I didnt have any oozing today (which ranged from bloody to straw color) until the BS wiped the area, the dermabond came off, and she was able to squeeze out more fluids.  ICK.  Sorry if that was graphic. She brought in the PS so they could both look.  BS said "It doesnt look infected, but if it doesnt improve, we'll have to take the TE out"....while PS said "it looks like a suture issue".  Its so nice they can agree. Long story short - I am on antibiotics orally and in creme form for 10 days as a safety measure.  They do not think its an infection but they were really happy I came in SO SOON after noticing the issue and not letting it get worse first.  AND I still keep my fill appt for Tuesday and if everything looks good then, I can continue as normal! So fingers crossed!  I really dont want to be this far along and to reject my TE at this point!  The only thing that has gotten me through the loss of my breast is the hope of them looking nice again. Sue
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 04:19PM SuebeeBC wrote: I still find myself wanting to sleep a lot.  Yesterday I was in the car for 9 hours, slept in the car and then went to bed at 8:30 last night - only a couple hours after getting home - and slept until 6 am.  I went to the grocery store and napped a solid hour this afternoon.  For me doing the slightest thing is nap worthy. And Im a month out now.  But Doc says its all normal and even asked me today to UP my calories and protein intake some more.  I feel like Im going to be huge after all of this but I am actually stable (maybe down a pound or two) even though I am eating like a mad dog. Im not up to bras yet as I have the figure of a pre-teen boy. I also havent had a fill yet because I have a small spot on the incision not healing - not infected - just SLOW.  So I dont think Ill be bra shopping for a while - I still wear my old one when I go out so I have a figure - and I can hug people (its heavily padded) but will have to bra shop when my TE side starts getting bigger than my natural side.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 06:05PM SuebeeBC wrote: Slinky!  I am so glad to hear that its not just me!  I too have a spot along the incision that just isnt healing.  After two weeks I started oozing all over the place - went in and got it checked but it was 'fine' and I got a cream and antibiotics in case.  a few days later - I had a noticible HOLE which freaked me out but they said it was 'fine'.  Im now at 4 weeks today - I havent had a fill but the doc says its 'FINE' just slow.  Now its just really red and I had some plaque in the hole which he plucked out. Anyway, he had me stop all strenuous activity and even stretching as to keep the stress on the site at a minimum. I walk and I have started making dinner - but they have to be really easy dinners. I too still get tired and take an afternoon nap daily.  My endurance is getting better but last week it was still horrible so I think you're fine, just on the slower side of the curve.  Believe me, at almost 3 weeks I got so itchy that I tried a little wii zumba and got a smackdown because thats when the hole popped open.  Take it easy - you (and I) will get there!
